Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: djt68
Reviews.Content: Good location in downtown Phoenix. Had lunch in the restaurant downstairs, great food and excellent prices. Room was nice, modern. The bed was very comfortable. Attended a conference, everything was easy to get to, meeting rooms were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “April 2012 - Conference”
Reviews.Author: LSkusa
Reviews.Content: I was at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown for the AIM conference just this past week (4 days, 3 nights). Tom at the dront desk is absolutely wonderful, genuinely nice, funny and helpful. The management and staff are to be commended for their customer service. I only had one complaint, I checked in on Tuesday, opted to be GREEN on Wednesday and didn't have my room serviced... when they cleaned my room on Thursday my sheets weren't changed... not even just my pillow cases... I didn't have my room a mess so if I knew all they were going to do was make the bed better than I already had, I've have opted for another GREEN day and gotten more points. Thank you Leo Percopo, you have a nice hotel and great poeple helping you keep it running :)

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very nice”
Reviews.Author: shastaball
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention as it was one of the 2 hotels that were blocked off. At$205 a night I scored. I was on the top floor with incredible views. I entered the room and saw a little half bath...almost freaked out because it didn't have a shower. Hmmm. Further investigation proved that I had a suite...a massive suite. 2 kig size beds with an ensuite. The place was well appointed, nicely decorated, very clean and full of built ins. If this place had a kitchenette (which it didnt) it would have been one of the nicer condos I've seen. The only thing that prevented me from giving thi place 5 stars was the ventilation system. The fan ran in the little half bath non-stop (whether the light was on or not) and it sounded like a freight train. I was worried I wouldnt be able to sleep, but eventually the noise became background noise. It is very loud, though. I don't know if it was the location of the room or if all rooms had this nuance. You should also be aware that the refrigerator is empty. It's nice to have, but if you're looking for a late night snack, don't count on your fridge to have any:) Room service was good, food was ok but nothing memorable. I appreciated that despite the fact that I had opted for the 'green' option - which means no cleaning service - they came and got the food tray despite my failure to call. It was a pleasant surprise when I came back to the room after a full day and the place didnt smell like eggs/pancakes because I had forgot to call. The location across the street from an AMC, starbux, etc is nice. You have quick breakfast options outside of the room service. Also a nice icecream shop for late night:). As another poster mentioned, unless there are moviegoers, the place is dead after 6pm. I walked around alot alone and wasn't worried about crime. The gym was great for a hotel gym. Enough tereadmills that I had a one minute wait for someone to jump off. Lap pool also looked incredible. The hotel is very centrally located, but the downtown Phoenix area isnt anything to get excited about.

Reviews.Title: “LOST LUGGAGE overnight!!! BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: E G
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to a relaxing getaway at this hotel. Arrived in the evening and was met by the bellman who I was assured would take my bags to my room. I arrive at my room late nite and my bags were not there. I called down to the front desk and was told that I needed to look in the armiore and the bags had to be in my room. Ok no bags...I went down to the bell desk where I was met by the security supervisor Kyle who told me that they were looking for them and just relax. After over an hour of investigating and searching at 1am and No Bags! They said that they called the bellman at home and would wait for a call back intil the morning. Ok were does that leave me? No medication, toothbrush, underwear or change of clothes to look forward to. Sleep? Nope! Waited to 7:30am and made a call to the Gen Mgr to inquire about the bags. They still had not located them. Knock on the door...security found my bags! This was awesome but when I called the Gen Mgr to ask for help I was told that they found my bags and the issue is resolved. I told them that loosing sleep in a hotel of this calibur is unacceptable. They offered to waive my valet fees and thats it! I needed to stay in AZ another nite and asked for a comp for the 2nd nite, Nope! Nice place but if you have problem beware they are right and you will be treated like crap! I decided to leave for the 2nd nite based on my poor experience. Guess what they charged my card and I did not even stay there! 7-10 days for refund..we'll see! SHAME on SHERATON!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSG123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 5 nights for a conference. The facility is very aesthetically pleasing. The lobby is quite impressive and beautifully decorated. There is a lot of open space with abundant light. My room was lovely with all the amenities that I needed. My only complaint would be lack of free internet service in the rooms. The fitness center was the biggest and nicest I have seen at any hotel or resort, ANYWHERE! Well done! The outdoor lap pool setting was lovely and a nice respite from the conference. Dining was also a pleasurable experience, plus there are several eateries directly across the street. Staff were phenomenally professional in all areas, although the housekeeping staff were not very friendly, in general. The "Green" program for housekeeping is nice, since I prefer to not have staff in my room unless necessary. I would recommend this hotel and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another EXCELLENT stay!!”
Reviews.Author: baby888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, my 2nd stay at this hotel. Fast and friendly valet service, beautiful large lobby, large gift shop (souvenirs, drinks, snacks, magazine, plus everything else which you may have forgotten to pack), Starbucks in the lobby area with a nice selections of pastries and snacks (love the takeout salads too), nice pool area (the lady that works there is very friendly and hard working), large gym area, good housekeeping (my compliments to housekeeper BAN for her friendliness and helpfulness), good room service. Numerous computers and printers in the lobby area as well. I arrived at 11am and was very pleasantly surprised that I able to check in right away, a great way to start my stay. Checkout was friendly as well. Good elevator service, never had to wait long for one to arrive. Very quiet rooms. Of course you can hear other doors closing in the hallways, but otherwise very soundproof rooms. Walking distance to Chase Field and US Airways Centre. Close drive to Scottsdale. This is definitely still one of my very favorite hotels, I look forward to staying here again next time I am in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected, and great service.”
Reviews.Author: YaleDad
Reviews.Content: My normal go-to hotel is not a Sheraton, but for a recent trip my client booked us in the Phoenix Sheraton Downtown. I very pleasantly surprised by above-quality service at check-in, a wonderful room, and great service from housekeeping and the restaurant during my two days here. I was glad to see the complimentary water bottle in the room (as well as Starbucks coffee), but frustrated at having to pay $11.95 for internet access. I slept well and loved the pillows supplied. There was a large convention during our stay but I heard very little noise from the hall or other rooms during my stay. This is a solid 3 star hotel that provides 4 star service. I'd not hesitate to come back here again, and I'll consider Sheraton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “That's a First - Walking into an occupied room!”
Reviews.Author: Fascistpork
Reviews.Content: Summary: Nice hotel. Decent room. Mixed bag service. No prior expectation, but disappointed for the rate. Tip: USE YOUR IN-ROOM SAFE (read below to understand why...) Booked downtown Sheraton for a quick sports staycation (Dbacks Friday, Suns Saturday). Figured we stay downtown and walk or pedicab around (no designated driver needed :-)). Booked the Sheraton for it's proximity to the ballpark and arena. Also, the company has decent negotiated rates w/ Starwood. Arrived and valet'd the car. Valet staff was uber-friendly and helpful. Went inside to monstrous lobby (w/ 25+ ft ceilings)... nice. Overall, the common areas of the hotel were quite attractive. Arrived at the front desk, greeted by pleasant young lady. Check-in was smooth (even signed up for SPG program - of course, these first spam arrived on my email before we made it upstairs! :-)). So, headed up to the 19th floor... Found our room and opened the door... At first, I thought the cleaning crew hadn't been in yet. I saw a shopping bag and a box by the garbage can. Then, I looked up and saw suitcases and clothing! Oops! Luckily no one was there (or I'm sure they'd have freaked out). Feeling a bit stunned, headed back down to the front desk. The same pleasant young lady saw us coming and gave a funny look. "Hi again, anything wrong?"... Well, ummm, only if we're not on the room-sharing program. So we advised her of the situation, and looking awfully confused, she turned suddenly and went back to the computer... muttering something about the annoying computer system. Quickly, she put us in a room on the 18th floor, giving us some explanation that "well, it just popped up" (meaning in the selection on the computer system). Nicely, but a bit too efficiently, she sent us along our way and quickly turned and walk back through a door behind the front desk - no doubt to go talk to a manager... No big deal - for us anyway. Yeah, I guess a little apology for the light inconvenience would have been nice, but whatever. But, what I can only imagine what the other guy (in the room that the hotel gave us a key to!) would think. I hope they did the right thing and told them, but given the clerk's obvious discombobulation, I'd have to guess no. Knowing this, we were very happy to find an in-room safe when we got to the room :-). Speaking of which, the room was clean and nicely, if a bit spartanly, decorated. Flat screen TV was mounted on the wall, but at 32" seemed way too small for a large wall with nothing else on it. Nice view over the north side of the city and mountains. Bathroom was clean, fairly large, and basic (about what you'd find in a Hilton Garden Inn or a Courtyard). The bed was nice, but too soft for our tastes - and we woke up feeling pretty sore. Got up next morning and ran down to get some coffee. Little coffee shop in the lobby with a starbucks menu. A couple of friendly guys working the counter. Chai and coffee, easy. A little bummed about having to wait about 2 minutes while the two employees finished listening to a story being told by a woman picking up her drink. I understand though. They were a couple young guys, and she was an attractive young woman. It happens :-). Check out was by video, but unlike some other chains, no paper copy of the folio is slipped under the door. So, stopped by the front desk to get a copy. Another pleasant young lady asked how she could help. Offered printed or email copy. Chose email. She asked where to send it. I answered to the one you have on file. Looking a bit annoyed, she says there is no email on file (weird, since my reservation showed on the SPG program site, and I had also received Starwood spam). Gave her my email again, and was told, OK, it's on it's way - not thank you, not goodbye, nope. Just done. Nice. Overall, the experience was disappointing. The hotel and room was pretty average and service was hit or miss. Seems computer systems and operating processes have some gaps. Woulda stuck with Hilton, but not one near sports venues...

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Sheraton I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: mike-lcf
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's because I wasn't expecting much based on my last few stays at Sheraton properties but I found this hotel to be unexpectedly good. Great lobby with high ceilings and courteous check in staff. The room itself looks recently remodeled with clean and new looking furniture. Complimentary bottled water in the room. Great view of the Arizona Diamondbacks stadium and downtown Phoenix. There is an outdoor shopping plaza across the street with a number and variety of good restaurants, including a movie theater. There is a good Mexican restaurant there. The only "miss" was that morning breakfast room service was delivered lukewarm (cold scrambled eggs, lukewarm ham and soggy wheat toast). The lackluster room service is the only reason I did not give this hotel five stars. Otherwise I was pleased with my stay and would definitely return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurae
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for a convention. We upgraded to the club level and were given a room just down the hall from the club room. The hotel is probably one of the more upscale hotels in Phoenix and the price does reflect it. It is big and there are a lot of people there, but it never seems crowded. Service for us was good, though we didn't use a lot of the different options. Started right off with the bell service when we drove up. Helpful and offered information on the floors on where we needed to be for the event we were attending. Room and Beds were so comfortable. Club room had very light breakfast starting at 6am - 11am. Free water, coffee, teas and soda's all day. Then at night, they would have a happy hour (3-7pm)with snacks (cheeses and different finger foods), but wine and beer were extra. There was always an attendant in the room. Lobby was a nice comfortable place to just sit and read to get away from the events happening on the convention floors. There are a lot of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. One thing I will comment on because I didn't not find it any references to cost of parking, because it was not included in our room rate. Parking (This is a downtown hotel, were parking is limited) is $17/night for self parking, but what is nice it is in a secure area under the hotel. I wish they had it on the website, but I had done some research and knew it ahead of time. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Prices for happy hour!!”
Reviews.Author: mzuder
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice-once in 3/11 and again in 3/12- the front desk staff was wonderful- very accommodating and friendly. The room was very clean and take advantage of the deal they have with a coupon in exchange for a daily clean (you still get fresh towels, etc.) The happy hour deals are great...both for food and drink. The pool was finished this year and we took advantage of that. One issue...many of the machines in the workout area were not working properly at the time we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility; not as great service”
Reviews.Author: Tripalyzer
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Phoenix is a beautiful hotel and it's in a great location. I heard it recently was given the award of best Sheraton. I can understand based on the facilities it could get that award, but not based on its service, which has plenty of room for improvement. Indeed I would have given it a five rating if not for service that was not up to snuff. Here's where the Sheraton fell short for our family visit: - Only two people at the check-in desk when we arrived and although there was only one couple in front of us, it took at least 10 minutes for us to be helped. - We ordered food at the bar in the lobby and it took way too long for the server to bring us condiments that were requested after the food arrived. - The guest services staff were not very resourceful or proactive in helping us with information. For example, when we asked where would be a nice park to take a young child, they only came up with one option and made no effort to come up with another option when I requested it. (We ended up asking a bell hop at the DoubleTree in Scottsdale when we saw the hotel along the road and he immediately sent us to a perfect park that we highly recommend to any families with small children: http://therailroadpark.com). Another example: when we asked for directions to the car rental return, the staff member simply said she didn't know, and she only asked someone else when I asked her to. - We returned after 12 noon from a morning outing and our room still had not been cleaned, so we had to arrange to be out of the room during our daughter's nap time to get it cleaned. - The quality of the food in the Club Room is somewhat disappointing. The pizza tastes no better than frozen pizza (and may even be frozen pizza). It seems the Sheraton is being penny wise and pound foolish by offering mediocre food in the Club Room. How much more could it cost to have really good quality food there and make a really great impression on Club level customers who by definition are willing to pay more to get more? - The elevators are poorly marked. The ones that say 1-17 should say B2-17, otherwise it's not obvious which elevators should be taken to get to the underground parking levels. - The technology of card keys in the elevators needs to be improved. For example, if you are going from a Club guest room on the 29th floor to the Club Room on the 28th floor, by the time you get the card into the slot and try to push the button for 28, you'll already be on your way to the lobby and have to come back up. If you are already on a Club floor, then you shouldn't have to use your card to go to another Club floor. Unless the elevators are dumb. Which they are. - The signs at the underground self-parking gate are confusing. Too many signs with seemingly contradictory information. Come on Sheraton Phoenix, you should be able to do a lot better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here Apr 8-12 (4 nights). I'm SPG Platinum and had requested an upgrade in advance which was granted several days before our arrival. Our room was on the 31st floor with nice views. The lobby is first class and spacious. The fitness centre is absolutely top of the line. The restaurants were good, service was excellent. The elevators are awesome with practically no wait time going up or down. The pool is great with lots of chairs, good sun, and good food/drink poolside. Right across the street is a 24 theater movie comples as well as many little shops and restaurants. Also 1 block from the Phoenix Convention Centre, 10 min drive from the Arizona Mills Shopping Centre, and a short walk to the baseball field and NBA arena. The underground parking was easy to get in/out. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Lorie B
Reviews.Content: I was a speaker this week at the IPMA Western Region Conference at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown. The staff provided phenominal service. Elvin, in presentation services, was outstanding. Elvin and the other staff constantly checked to make sure that everything was set up properly. When you needed anything the staff was on it right away and with such a postive attitude. The help and service I received was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel...close to everything”
Reviews.Author: JLangs
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to visit Phoenix for a business conference and stayed at the Sheraton Downtown. The hotel was the perfect venue for the meeting but just as important, it was a perfect location for after meeting activities. Close to restaraunts and pubs it offered us a place to relax and unwind. Also it was within walking distance of Chase Field and the D-Backs were in town....perfect. My one recommendation if you do stay at the Sheraton is to opt for the Club Level upgrade. The lounge on the 28th.floor complete with a full continental breakfast and evening snacks plus coffee 24 hours a day make it worth the extra extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place...would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ThePoundcake
Reviews.Content: I went to Phoenix and stayed at the Sheraon for three nights. The rooms were clean, well furnished, and a good size. The fitness center has about eight treadmills, bikes, ellipticals and weight machines. It was more than most hotels in this price range carry. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, but not much shopping. The service staff was friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MacJ345
Reviews.Content: I had a six night stay in the Sheraton and it was awesome. I stayed in the standard king bedroom. In my opinion, compared to other hotels I the room it self was smaller than most but the bathroom was larger than most which made up for it. The bed it self was comfortable and the desk was great work space; although I didn't use the desk for internet ( $15/perday). There is a cyber cafe in the lobby with free internet access. I was there on business but I did have a ton of time outside of meetings to check things out. which leads me to location. I was able to walk to the museum, the Suns stadium, Chase field, and Pizzeria Blanco ( a definite must ) all from the hotel. The concierge was great with giving direction for all us directionally challenged folks. The hotel is also in good proximity to public transit if that's your mode of transportation. Additionally, pedal taxi as well as the traditional taxi are easy to flag down. The overall customer service was really excellent. I called the front desk 3 times( for a bottle opener, a new light bulb for the lamp, and once for room service )during my stay and every request was met in record time. One thing that I found interesting was the going "green" initiative. You can but a placard outside your door that says that housekeeping does not to change change your sheets.As incentive for more people to do that they give $5 voucher to the hotel restaurant. So I could have racked up $30. However, if you put the placard out then housekeeping doesn't come at all. Perhaps they will change the policy. I understand that by not changing the sheets everyday you save energy, water, soap, and eventually labor cost; but I personally would just like to have the bed made and the trash taken away every day. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Almost there - disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: bsannich
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days/three nights here in March 2012. The property itself is great - in a decent spot in downtown Phoenix, the lobby is very expansive and beautiful, and it has all of the "bones" of a great hotel. The gym was one of the best I have ever seen, and the pool has a lot of potential (more on this later). Most of the staff was very, very friendly and all were helpful. The room was 'ok'. I was on the 27th floor facing north. It was nothing special, but also got the job done. The desk was a good size, and the bathroom was well-lit and had plenty of room. The gift shop had a lot of "gifty-type" things in it, but not very much in the way of food/drink (which is to be expected I think). The staff in there was extremely friendly every time I was in there, which was a couple times a day. The elevators were a marvel of modern engineering - it seemed that no matter where I was, there was almost no wait for an elevator. I have honestly never seen anything like it before. The gym was a highlight - I believe it branded as Core Performance (or something similar), and they did a great job with it. Tons of room, lots of good equipment, and it had a wall of glass overlooking the pool area. Very nice. Now for some of the bad: * The person in the room before me has long dark hair. How do I know that? Because it was everywhere. On the bed, on the desk, on the bathroom sink, and in the shower. It was pretty obvious that it was there, so I don't know how the housekeepers missed it. * The pool area was nice - but not maintained. At all. There were used towels on a lot of the chairs and some garbage left over from previous days, the pool deck area needed to be swept, and the pool needed to be skimmed. The tables and chairs were all over the place (no order whatsoever). It was generally a mess. It was very obvious that nobody is in charge of keeping the pool area clean. Things can get busy during the day, but seeing it in this condition in the morning was a sign to me that no effort was made to clean up the mess from the day before. * The service in the pool area bar was pretty bad. I was there three days with two different bartenders/servers. The service was alright, but their attitudes were not. One day, the girl was just not friendly (no biggie). The next day, the guy seemed overworked, and gave me the impression that it was a bother to order some food and drinks. The third day, the same guy was a little rude when I asked a question about the hours. Every other person in the hotel was very, very friendly - so maybe that's why these two looked so bad. * I went to get taxis a could times, and always ended up with a car service that was way too expensive for what I needed. Oh, and how could I forget - they have no meter. So it is completely up to the driver to decide what to charge you once you get dropped off. I ended up going off the property and getting a regular taxi, and the driver said that the Sheraton does not allow regular taxis on the property, and only pushes the use of the significantly more expensive car service. This was confirmed with TWO other cabbies. They mentioned that the hotel staff is "in on it" and gets kickbacks for this, but obviously that can't be proven. Regardless of the background, I think it is kind of shady that they call you over a car with no meter, and pass it off as a cab. Just something to be aware of. * This isn't necessarily important to some, but I am an SPG Gold member, and was not offered a room upgrade nor a late checkout. Yes, these two perks are provided "when available", but there was zero hesitation to say "no" when I asked for either. There is a cool little area across the street that has some good restaurants and bars. I would definitely recommend checking it out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly5575
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and overall the hotel was great. They provide a large space in the lobby which is perfect for meeting friends and colleagues and the elevators were wonderful, possibly the best elevators in a hotel ever. There were plenty of them and they were fast and you never had to wait long. Even at busy times. The room was clean but I felt the bed and the pillows were too soft. I would have appreciated the choice of firm or feather pillows. The hotel is also located directly across from the Arizona Center, which has quite a few restaurants and shops. Overall, I enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Food is God Awful!”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: Wow, I can't believe for such a huge, beautiful hotel how BAD the food is here. Stayed for a few days with a business event, and we were served multiple terrible, unhealthy meals (i.e. dinner offered NO protein except for greasy dark meat chicken WITH the skin on it - blech! Who eats that in this day and age?? other dinner items included white dinner rolls, french fries and a seven layer nacho dip. Are you freaking kidding me??) Nowhere to even buy yourself a healthy granola/protein/energy bar. The whole conference nearly starved to death. Also, after my stay, had to speak to Billing/Purchasing about an incorrect charge on my bill. Boy, was this guy rude - Copped a serious attitude. These guys have to learn some customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Party Stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidA8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton with my wife for my work Christmas Party in Dec 2011. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was prepared for the influx of guest for our company upon check in and check out. We did not have to stand in long lines waiting. The room was comfortable and the view of the city was great. The Ginger bread house display in the lobby was really cool.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel Gem”
Reviews.Author: wam372
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference earlier this week and was impressed with the friendliness of all staff that I encountered. The were helpful and wiling to fond solutions for my colleague's challenging allergies throughout the conference. The conference meals (there were 7 in total) were all creative and for the most part had a wide selection of healthy choices--which is rare! When i wanted to explore a bit, the hotel arranged my car rental pick up and drop off and I was offered to option for forgo housekeeping in return for 500 Starwood points per day which I was happy to take. The only suggestion is to offer free internet to Starwood members as a standard of business. Its very frustrating to have to pay 14.95 per day while attending a business conference at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honesty and Integrity”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreNZ
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown on a business trip. On arriving home I discovered that somewhere on my trip back to Virginia I had misplaced my very expensive noise control earphones. I sent an email to the various stops along the way asking if they had been found. That day I got a phone call from the security head at the Sheraton to tell me that I had indeed left my earphones in the room and he arranged to have them returned to me. They are now safely back in my care. It is nice to know that from the cleaning staff through to the security head all were part of the chain to return to me something of value to myself so quickly and efficiently. It is good to know that honesty and Integrity are alive and well In the Phoenix Downtown Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Livinthrutravel
Reviews.Content: We made our room reservation months before going and were very disappointed when we checked in and were told that we would not have a room with a king size bed but would have 2 double beds instead. We were told that it is the hotel policy to only guarantee that you have a room but not necessarily the room you that you had reserved. We will not be staying there again since we can not be assured that they will honour our reservation request.

Reviews.Title: “Recently in Phoenix for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Don D
Reviews.Content: You could not want more attention than you'll get at this hotel. The staff (notably JasonS & Shawn) were extremely helpful handling my bags and travel needs during a tightly scheduled business trip. There attentiveness and willingness were much appreciated. BTW - the room and view of north Phoenix, especially the evenings, were excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A330FA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights this week. I highly recommend it. The rooms are new, clean and extremely comfortable. Flat screen TV, coffee makes with Starbucks in the room. The hotel gym is one of the best I have ever been in. The staff is engaging, very friendly and helpful. They make you feel that they truely value your patronage. Hotel is in a great location close to sporting venues and a variety of restaurants. I would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lindsay Leaferts”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at your hotel during the SNAXPO convention. In addition to the overall quality service, I would like to personally mention one of your staff, Lindsay Leaferts. Lindsay is a server in the lobby coffee shop. As I was struggling with a printer and my laptop. Lindsay offerd to assist me connect to the system and download a very important document that I needed for the convention. Thanks to Lindsay I was able to print the documents and have them ready in time for a meeting with a very important client. Lindsay did not have to offer her services as she was busy behind the coffee counter, but thank god she did. She saved me that day. Lindsay deservs a big hand. My many thanks Mark Carlson [--].

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeaTraveler77
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay in downtown Phoenix normally when traveling to AZ, but I would definitely recommend the Sheraton for work travel. From the outside it looks like it could be a little outdated, but they have obviously redone the interior fairly recently and the rooms are great. Modern, spacious, comfortable beds, etc. Room service was quick and very good as well. Also, instead of having me take a cab a short distance the man outside had their airport shuttle drive me so I didn't have to pay for a cab (very nice I thought). I did think it was a bit strange though - the day I was checking out, housekeeping came before 9AM, and then I was packing later that morning (close to, but not after checkout time), the woman came back and told me she would help me tidy up the room as I finished packing. Obviously wanting me out of there... strange. Overall, would recommend though!

Reviews.Title: “TPE/NASPA”
Reviews.Author: NathanielSchultz
Reviews.Content: After being emailed numerous times about a concern about how the Sheraton treat a openly gay couple, the trip was met with some hesitations. However upon my late arrival I was treated very well and was also facing some difficulty with my credit card they said it could wait until the morning and really made me feel welcomed. I stayed there a total of 8 days and it was refreshing and relaxing the only bigg downside were the drink prices and the 15.00 charge for internet. But the coincierges were very helpful, Kristin in particular and Delia at a check-in counter. The convience ion location and roof top pool and hot tub were incredible. Well they had amazing facilities for working out and an impressive lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: adventurebuddy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on spg points at the last minute not knowing where else to stay in Phoenix. While I wouldn't recommend staying here if you're looking to explore the wider Phoenix area, if you have a car then it's as good as any place. The hotel itself is excellent, with great views and facilities. The self parking was very easy to use some came and went as we pleased. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Clearly it caters more to the business traveller than the tourist but it served our needs very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for conferences”
Reviews.Author: Justabizstraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff was SOOO friendly! Edward offered us water on our way out just because! The valet person was so helpful in recommending a great dinner spot away from all the conference traffic. I was honestly very skeptical when our company chose Downtown Phoenix as their location. So long as you stay near the hotel you'll be pleasantly surprised too!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: M K
Reviews.Content: Stayed hear for three nights for a business trip/convention. The hotel is conveniently located in downtown Phoenix and is walking distance to the conference cent and many restaurants. The Sheraton is also one of the tallest buildings so it is easy to see when you are walking around making it difficult to get lost. There is a large restaurant with decent food and a large bar both places were well used by the patrons of the convention. This facility also has a number or meeting rooms. The actual room was okay. Nothing special. My room had two doubles although I was traveling alone. The room felt a little small. I was in an end room and I think it was designed to be a family suite so that the other room across the corridor would be mom and dads room and mine was the kids room. The window was very small. The very small tv was wall mounted and next to the window so you had to close the drapes to watch tv during the day. There was a small wardrobe no closet. There was little storage anywhere a total of two tiny drawers. There was no place to store more than one small roller board. Generally this hotel is fine and better than average for a business trip. I spent very little time in the room. But I would not stay in this hotel for family trip. Partly because this place seems to be geared for convention center events.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, courteous and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: valpofred
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel was enjoyable during a four night stay in March. Staff was very courteous and helpful in arranging transportation and suggesting areas to visit and places to dine. Nice neighborhood and very close to professional baseball and basketball facilities. Convention center is one block away. Clean restaurant and lobby provided several options for socializing.

Reviews.Title: “spot on”
Reviews.Author: steve m
Reviews.Content: this hotel is obviously very well managed. i have stayed there on multiple occasions, and every time i am greeted with people providing excellent service, (not just doing a job). of all the hotels that i have stayed at it ranks as the best, for a "city" type, (i.e. as compared to a resort type). you wont be disappointed, kudos to the "employees"

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: spedteacherytown
Reviews.Content: Great customer service! Had a small snafu with my work credit card and they handled it very well. Rooms were amazing, beautiful views of city ( Could see the baseball game!) Love the pool on the upper deck. Was just a great hotel. One of the best I have ever stayed at and I am a HUGE hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome lunch and Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Emily G
Reviews.Content: Lunchtime at The District is always fantastic! The food is delicious and the service is Excellent!! They have an outstanding staff beginning with Jason, manager, who always warmly welcomes us and Ryan, our server who is amazing.. Best regards, Emily Gesuale

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: alwaystraveling74
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times now, and I've always had a great experience. The staff knows what they're doing, the rooms seem to be recently refurbished, and the District restaurant was really pretty good. The lobby in particular is stunning and it's fun to have a few drinks at the lobby bar. The hotel is fairly centrally located in downtown Phoenix, within walking distance of just about everything. Just a side note that has nothing to do with the hotel....downtown Phoenix is pretty dead on Sundays, except for the many homeless people that can be pretty aggressive about asking for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Starwood Property”
Reviews.Author: Sveenz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great!! Its a rather new property with a spacious lobby including an inviting bar and efficient elevators. Staff is very friendly and helpful and they can advise you with things to do in the area or directions to some place to eat or drink. The rooms are comfortable and look brand new. The bed is very comfy, of course, they are Starwood heavenly beds I guess. There is a lot of meeting room and a spacious gym as well. With regards to the swimming pool, that is probably the only part I could criticise, it doesn’t look very appealing. All in all it’s a very nice property; I wish other Sheratons were at the same standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For A Conference”
Reviews.Author: 26.2er
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel while I was there for a conference in April of 2011. It is within easy walking distance of shops and other points of interest in Pheonix. I found the staff to be very attentive. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The hotel gym was great! An added touch was the sustainable garden and herbs that are grown on the deck. All the way around a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel convenient for Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: ChiFT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days for a conference at the Convention Centre. There are a few things I like about this hotel, and a few things I dont. Here they are: Like: - Very convenient for the Convention Centre - a few minutes walk away. - Beautiful lobby and I love the style. The floor space of the lobby is something like 4 or 5 times that of the Hyatt Regency and Renaissance nearby. Together with the 2 or 3 storey high ceiling makes this a very spacious lobby indeed. - My room is on one of higher floors and had a great view towards the convention centre and the Basilica. It is spacious and very comfortable. Especially like the work table facing the windows, The climate control system is good, the decor is good. The room has an empty fridge (which is great), coffee making machine, radio-alarm clock, wired internet access, iron and ironing board. . One of the reason I chose this hotel is they have in-room safe - which is essential for peace of mind. - Staff are very friendly - from the door staff, to concierge to restaurant and reception. The restaurant staff are esepcially good. - Great for meeting people - there is a bar with very comfy seating in the lobby, and another bar next to the restaurant Not too keen about: - I do miss the floor to ceiling window in some newer hotels - not in this one. - Location - great for convention centre, but downtown Phoenix is really pretty dull - choice of restaurant is limited and shopping - is non-existent. - Restaurant is OK, but not brilliant. - For a hotel of this size and class, I would have expected more than one restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable accomodations downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: izymassage
Reviews.Content: very pleased with the staffing , accommodations, restaurant, and especially the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time - Still fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: littleeve
Reviews.Content: OK - usually when you arrive and discover that a hotel is overbooked, a tantrum seems appropriate. Not necessary with this hotel. I received an honest and factual report of the reason the situation occurred, and then Sarah proceeded to take care of everything. She secured a room at a very nice hotel and even included round trip transportation and free internet at the other hotel for the night I was inconvenienced. If ever I am in Phoenix again, this is where you will find me!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa H
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel is lovely. Convenient to the Convention Center where my husband had a conference and our family tagged along for vacation time., Also convenient to colleges/universities, downtown attractions and a variety of restaurants. Also convenient to interstate highways and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: sandy f
Reviews.Content: We had to come to phoenix for work. when we arrived everyone was so helpful and friendly.the rooms were great and the beds are to die for.when we went to the lobby bar looking for somewhere to eat.Jerry the bartender went above and beyond with helping us.We ended up staying at the bar alot longer then intended.he treated us like we were old friends.it was nice to feel like i was home away from home.You need more like him.thanks again jerry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: ALO_YYZ
Reviews.Content: I try to stay here when visiting on business. Good downtown location Try to find street parking, it's cheaper. Breakfast buffet has decent selection Clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: easterbread
Reviews.Content: Well, we stayed at this hotel two years ago and had a not so great experience. Well, we just got back from our second stay yesterday and what a difference!! What can I say? Friendly, clean, and so nice. I don't know what management has done but I hope they keep doing it. If you have to wait in line, you are offered a complimentary water. We drove up from Tucson to see a concert and the next morning, they asked us how the concert was. They remembered! The room smelled clean, but not like room deodorizer just clean. I can't stand it when hotels just spray a bunch of perfumy deodorizers. This room was just clean and did not smell like anything. Fantastic! The pool/whirlpool area was such a pleasure. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. Love the property and love the people... Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Garlena R
Reviews.Content: Brooke at the front desk went beyond her duties in providing services during my 5 day stay. I was very impressed with all the staff, especially the concierge and bell man. They were all friendly and helpful. I have a disability and really appreciated the attention they provided to meet my needs. The pool was awesome. Thanks for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: bpaine
Reviews.Content: My husband's convention prompted a stay at this lovely hotel, just a block away from the Convention Center, three short blocks from the clean cheap Metro Light Rail/Bus Station. Stayed on 22nd floor, very nice quiet room with a deeply comfortable bed. Outdoor lap pool was comfortable, the view is wonderful - and the bartender was polite and welcoming (did wish there'd been a shower close by before entering pool, tho). Concierge staff helpful in offering directions and suggestions for visiting nearby attractions, and the Phoenix Ambassador program (look for the orange shirts downtown!) quick with coupons and good advice. Opted for the Green Choice program and added the points to our Starwood account later; housekeeping staff very patient with exchanging towels from their carts - always ready with a smile. Used the internet in the LINK cafe, and staff there helpful with troubleshooting and cafe (banana bread is delicious). Downtown Phoenix is weirdly, eerily quiet with little street-level retail or even humans (except for conventioneers walking from center to hotel) - unlike, say, Boston - not a CVS or fast food place in sight. All in all, loved this hotel, every staff member helpful and cheery, am looking forward to staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: MJCMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite at this hotel, and the room was incredibly large and clean. The location is great close to many restaurants and the convention center. The staff was incredibly helpful and offered grea advice for fun things to do nearby. You can tell Sheraton spent a fair amount of money building this hotel and it shows. Room service was prompt and delicious. The pool was pretty small, as the hotel was quite full. All in all a great property to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificently exceeded all expectations.”
Reviews.Author: madame_kate28
Reviews.Content: When is a hotel particularly memorable? We don't need a hotel to enjoy breathtaking scenery, or relax in a heated lap pool. Or even savor a better-than-French meal that includes succulent shrimp from the local Arizona desert shrimp farm or herbs picked fresh for my meal from the herb garden on the fourth floor. What will make this hotel memorable is that I was treated as a treasured, irreplaceable person. There are not 1000 rooms in this hotel, as their website purports; there is only one, and it is the room I occupied. A special mention goes to their restaurant manager, Cliff: The discrete attentiveness reflective of his Continental origins made me feel like Audrey Hepburn in "Breakfast..."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and efficient, and all staff was very welcoming! I had forgotten my phone charger and although the hotel didn't have an extra one on hand to lend me, they let me charge my phone behind the conceirge desk. The room was also very clean and quiet. We enjoyed our time by the outdoor pool located on the 4th floor. The food was a bit over-priced but expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very plain...”
Reviews.Author: Saskatchewan83
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is "cookie cutter"...from the check in (you could tell they recited their "greeting" like robots) to the incredibly boring rooms. I assume we would have had a nice view, but there was a huge table in front of the window so we couldn't see. Beds were very comfortable. The gym and pool area were very nice. The lobby seemed to be an extension of the meeting rooms, which led to it being extremely busy and uninviting for "tourists"...in this day and age, $13 a day for wireless is outrageous. We didn't check out as the line up was 100 people long. the coffee shop was even more busy, but there's a Starbucks across the street. Overall, an extremely average stay...I assume all the great reviews are buisness travelers. It's a very crowded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Quick Visit”
Reviews.Author: Cheweywashere
Reviews.Content: Club Floors are the Best. Breakfast and afternoon snacks save the day for busy guests. Would highly recommend this hotel. Excellent gym, cardio equipment and pool for swimming or relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent quality”
Reviews.Author: Frantix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip last week. My room was on the 18th floor with a view to the West. The view itself stretched far beyond the Phoenix city limits to the vast deserts to the mountains, a nice setting for a deeply contemplative person. :) Ask for one of the upper floors and you will love it! Pros: The check-in process was quick and easy -- they have a great "Green" program where they give you $5 credit or 500 Starwood points for every night that you refuse cleaning service. Eco-friendly and rewarding! The bed was fantastic, I slept like an eight month old baby. Nice flat screen TV with many cable channels, but a bit slow to switch from the menu. The bathroom and linen were very clean, everything worked, no issues. The decor was elegant, nothing special but I was staying in a room in the Bellagio. The staff was extremely courteous, especially the welcome group outside. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable, finding you a cab or pointing you to the right place. Cannot beat the location -- Phoenix is very spread out but this is right across a huge mall with an AMC theater. Many places to eat with every kind of cuisine a short walk away. There was not really a whole lot of traffic (I'm from Boston) and I liked that the Phoenix Convention Center was right around the corner. I have stayed at this hotel and the Hyatt next door, and both are very comparable. The Sheraton arguably has the better gym but Hyatt has the better restaurant. That said, Sheraton wins because its gift shop is much much superior! Cons: I have a couple of minor quibbles. First, there is NO wireless internet in the rooms, which is surprising because this is a four star downtown hotel. Then they charge you $12.95 for the ethernet, which is a bit of a rip off (and hence I deduct one star). Also there is no concession for SPG members, which is a bit strange. In general, if you're not traveling on business, the room rates could burn a hole in your wallet! Overall, I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a hassle-free stay in an elegant hotel. Great quality in all respects!

Reviews.Title: “High Expectations - Missed in a few areas”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: I really had high expectations when arriving at this hotel due to the high rating here. Maybe I have stayed in too many boutique-type hotels, as this hotel was HUGE, but very typical BOX style lobby, hallways and rather small room....what you would expect from any other big-name hotel. Upon check-in service was very pleasant and professional, and the room was ready at around 12pm. I thought the room rate was VERY high ($250.00 - conference rate) for the amenities offered here, and there certainly was not much to attract you to this area of Phoenix except for the Convention Center about 2-blocks away. The downtown area here appeared to be empty. The Arizona Center across the street was very sad, and just about empty of stores as well. Looks like this is the area for the sporting events, which may be why this downtown area even exists, and if that's the case surely Phoenix will build up this area to attract more people and money. The pool area was at a lower level, and the view from the pool and outside bar was of adjacent building walls....no view at all! I was hoping to see a beautiful Arizona sunset from either of these areas but no. The room was typical and my first impression was that it was rather small. The bed was wonderful, with very nice linens. The hotel and room appeared to be very clean. They are serving Starbucks coffee in the business center area with amazing pastries made right on site. The restaurant "District" impressed us the first night, and when we ate there again 2 days later the service was abysmal. The waiter was telling how special their garden is, with organic items served yet it appeared that the wait-staff was working their first night ever in a restaurant. At $100.00 per couple (no wine) the service and food should be impeccable. The menu was quite creative, however, and I was never served cotton-candy as a final treat when the check is delivered. Nice touch and very creative! If they obtain experienced professional wait-staff then they will truly have a special restaurant. Overall our stay was fine, but I will not stay in this area again when I return to the Phoenix area. I will stay in the Scottsdale area where there is lots to see, do, and places to eat. I really liked that the Execucar Limo service was stationed at the hotel, so getting around town was convenient but rather expensive, but at least there was this option.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant business hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelaround48
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights while on business. The hotel was within walking distance to my trade show at the convention center. The lobby of this new Starwood property is very grand especially for a Sheraton. The decor is tastefully bland as are the rooms. My room was clean and just big enough for my limited needs but my "sweet sleeper bed" was quite lumpy as memory foam mattresses tend to become very quickly. I do wish Sheraton could be part of the heavenly bed program. The District restaurant was excellent! I ate in the restaurant for breakfast and lunch while I had dinner in my room. I must say the best part of the stay was the well trained and very friendly helpful staff! I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: thisisunreal
Reviews.Content: My stay here was for a business conference. The Hotel was very nice compared to others that I have been to in other business trips. I arrived in the afternoon and checked in very quickly. The room was nice and clean. It was smaller than other hotels of this class but fine with me. The bathroom was larger than some but lacked the separate tub and walk in shower that I would expect in this type of hotel. There is a flat screen tv on the wall however it could have been larger but then I am not complaining because I really did not spend much time watching. I am not sure if the conference group payed for the wireless Internet but I really loved that it was at no cost to me and I could run my laptop, iPad and iPhone during my entire stay! A great feature of this hotel is the free 24 hour gym. I was able to go use the treadmill at 5am well before my meetings which I have found difficult in other places and usually it costs around $20 per day. The equipment is new. If you want to grab some casual dinner there is a nice complex of shops and restaurants across the street. The hotel has a couple of restaurants but I did not eat at them during my stay. We did go to a wonderful steakhouse, Durant's, one night. Overall I would recommend this hotel for mainly the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “The slowest check-in ever, good location, nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: TravelingIsFun01
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms - one double bed room and one suite. The check in process was the slowest I've ever experienced - took about 20-25 minutes. The computer wouldn't add up the totals, so she had to add it in manually. We prpaid for parking ($17 per car) and she told us to swipe our hotel room key to open the gate. It worked for the suite, but not for the double room. Annoying! The lobby is nice. The rooms were fine - not the most up to date, but fine. The location is great - walking distance to the convention center and downtown businesses.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacaBoy
Reviews.Content: First stay for small meeting. Comfortable room with usual amenities, public areas very clean and updated, excellent food in restaurant and meeting rooms. Staff is great, from front door through all services - friendly, helpful, competent. I'll visit here again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: touron2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most friendly and professional hotel staff i have ever experienced. From check-in through check-out everyone we interacted with exceeded our expectations on every single day of our five day visit. The lobby and meeting rooms were clean and spacious and our guest room was clean and comfortable. The Sheraton Phoenix Downtown will be my first choice for staying in Phoenix from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Service of Most of The Sheraton Associates”
Reviews.Author: Barbara W
Reviews.Content: Most every one of the Sheraton Employees have provided stellar, top drawer service. Let's start with Adrienne my culinary server. Adrienne was a delight. She was prompt, attentive, friendly and just down right charming. She actually spent extra time being a great listener when I needed an extra minute of friendship. She is top notch. Then of course there is Nick at the front desk. OMG he simply graciously went above and beyond by giving and giving again excellent service and friendship. He went beyond his duties to deliver excellent service and assistance to not just me but everyone that he worked with. Jess at the front desk was terrific! Rebecca in the restaurant was gracious, giving and accomdating offering from beginning to the end excellent service. Even though I have been sick during my stay at the Sheraton these individuals and others have made my stay a pleasantly memorable experience. Thankfully, Barbara Williams Merced, California

Reviews.Title: “Experience sincere customer service at Sheraton Downtown”
Reviews.Author: arizonarutz
Reviews.Content: Travelled for a national conference at the downtown conference center in Phoenix. As an AZ native with family in town, don't usually stay in Phx hotels but what the heck, may as well stay close to the many conf activities. What stood out at this Sheraton was the room service. What makes room service exceptional? Truth be told the food was fine but it was the server who impressed me. For example, as she walked in the room, she noticed that I was watching TV and said, "If I put the dinner tray here on this table, you can watch comfortably". Such a nice gesture in that she was sincere in her efforts to offer great customer service. And so she did. The next time, I ordered room service and she arrived at my door, we greeted each other like old friends. Nice comfy, quiet rooms as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: cellapink
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for three nights while attending a national conference. I would give this a 4.5 if I could. For a large, sterile, business hotel, it retains a certain warmth. The decor and furnishings are crisp, clean, up-to-date. The hotel staff are accommodating and professional. The public areas of the hotel are conducive to social interaction. I had occasion to attend several meetings in other downtown Phoenix hotels during my stay and the Sheraton was clearly superior to the others. If you are attending a business function in the downtown Phoenix area, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Very Comfortable, Great Location, CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Deb H
Reviews.Content: I travel often and stay at all types of Hotels. The Phoenix Downtown Hotel is my all time favorite after 25 years on the road. I have stayed there several times over the past 3 years and each time is has been a wonderful experience. The desk staff are always incredibly attentive and they took care of me like I was the top VIP in the hotel. They were very charming and professional. The location is perfect for working downtown or catching the Diamond Backs and/or Suns. The bar and restaurant staff are excellent. Food and drinks are worth the money. Great place to eat/drink alone or with a group. Great atmosphere and very affordable. The housekeeping staff is superb. I will stay there again and hope to vacation there soon. I wish all the hotels I stayed in were so nice. See you there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Super Staff, GREAT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: JulianaLowe
Reviews.Content: I travel often and try to stay at Sheraton locations all over the place, however, this one was exceptional. It was consistent in appearance and cleanliness of the rooms, however, the lobby, restaurant and work-out room were exceptional! It is also situated well in downtown Phoenix and most everything you need while traveling was just a few blocks walk away. Lastly, the staff was super friendly and helpful. Great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: DougDallas
Reviews.Content: Personel and the Property are excellent. All needs were immediately responded to, from early check in, holding bags, room requests, to a 4am check-out and garage assistance. Giant lobby is inviting and comfortable, even when busy. The Club room had excellent morning and evening food and service. I would stay again over "trying" another property.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to ring in the new year”
Reviews.Author: Pam N
Reviews.Content: I just recently visited the Sheraton in Downtown Phoenix for New Year's Eve and had a blast!! The room was exactly what we expected, very clean and the Bose stereo system was a plus. When we arrived to check in there was a pretty substantial line, but it moved quickly and once we went to check-in our desk agent Sarah was really pleasant and helpful. Even though I'm from the area I had a few questions about downtown and Sarah gave us some great advice on places to grab a bite before the festivities began. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luckily, they provided excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Hourray
Reviews.Content: I got into Phoenix from Vegas; a city where my last night of sleep had been far from good....I was thus terribly worried when I realised that we were staying in a connecting room (which I hate cuz their walls always seem to be paper thin) AND i saw 3 coaches full of young adults rolling in.... The kids did create havoc, but luckily, the staff was able to move us from the paper-thin connecting room wall to a non connecting room in 10 min flat! THAT is good service! They have great accomodations and are well located (right in front of the Arizona center where there's a movie theater and a reallyyyy good restaurant "Brick" and a 15 min walk to Chase Field and US Airways arena as well as the light rail station). We also ate at their restaurant (District) and although a bit pricey, was pretty good Lastly, if u're the type of person who enjoys a (or more) stiff drink in ur room at the end of night, better buy/bring ur own...the bottle of absolut vodka is available for 175 or 195$ in their in room menu....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ScottyFantastic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton over New Years Eve. Had a great experience. The hotel is very centrally located in downtown Phoenix and you can easily walk to all of the attractions. Our room was very nice with a great view. Spent some time in the District lounge within the hotel. A nice place to have a drink and they had a jazz band playing. The check-in and out process was a little strange, but I think they were very busy and the hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: Although my trip to the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown was for business, I would definately stay here for pleasure. The staff was extremely plesesant; I was treated as a VIP. Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: r8402
Reviews.Content: I have a mixed review. I'm rating this as excellent, but I did encounter problems. While visiting a family member in the hospital, I neglected to book a hotel. This was a few days after Thanksgiving at the begining of December. Almost everywhere near, or around the hospital was booked up. I thought of the Sheraton, because I know for a fact they have 1,000 rooms, and highly doubted that all one thousand rooms would be booked. As I inquired about the rooms, Jess from the front desk was cheerful. and with a smile on her face; she says "Sir, we have one thousand rooms here at this property. We're not even close to being half full. I have plenty of rooms available." I had a AAA discount, and she quickly changed her mood and said "Oh, sorry. We're sold out of extending discounts." I was a little surprised at that. With not being close to half full as she says, you would figure that one would be more than happy to offer a discount to keep the customer from walking away. Not trying to squeeze every penny out of the customer. I was tired at that point. Too tired to keep searching for a place to stay, and emotionally tired giving the situation with my family memeber being in the hospital. I said "That's fine, I got no other choice" I told her. She could tell I was upset aside from the price, and asked what was wrong. I was in needed of unloading my problems, so I told her. She offered her sympothy, and said the standard price was $179. With the hotel I work at, we're trained to say "The rate is ___ plus tax." I had flat out asked if the $179 was before or after tax, and she stood firm and said "$179" and wrote it on my key card. I have a friend that works for a Westin near Anaheim, but he was unable to fax over the paperwork to get me a Starwood Family/Friend Rate. I'll be honest. The lobby is warm and inviting. The lights are very low for ambiance, but it is hard to see inside, especially at the front desk. My room was small, but nice. The HVAC unit didn't work, and I did report it, but nothing was ever done about it. Jess was nice enough to send up a complementary plate of heart shaped chocolates, and wrote a nice note on it. To me, that showed she cared. The bed was very comfortable, but since I was on the 27th Floor, it did get chilly over night. On check out, I spoke with another front desk agent, and noted to her that maintence had never came by to my room to look at the HVAC unit, and she didn't seem to care. She was a blonde lady. I was hoping to get a discount for the trouble, but she said "I'll forward this to my manager, and someone will contact you in a few days." No one ever did. My final bill was over $200. I said "I was told it was $179. I had asked a few times if that rate was before or after tax, and I got the same answer '$179.' " This desk agent said "Well, I don't know why she didn't tell you it was $179 plus tax. I do apologize." I only made a fuss about my cold room, because when you take a nice hot shower, and open the bathroom door, you're greeted by the cold air in the room. Overall, I was pleased by the hotel, with the exception of the minor problems. The decor was nice. Their grand Christmas display was very nice. The bartender was great also.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: srilankanqueen
Reviews.Content: I was there during Christmas weeken and due to that reason everything was slow and quiet. The hotel is located right next to convention center as well As ASU. However, the hotel is not located near many stores, bars etc. this area is mainly a business district. The room was very clean. The bed was very nice. It was very comfortable. I had a queen bed, the sheets were clean and soft. The room was carpeted. The bathroom was very clean. The room had complimentary water bottles. Has a fridge. Self parking per night was $17.00. If i ever go back to Phoenix AZ I def will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and hardworking, and the gym is huge and full of great workout equipment. Nice rooms, good location right across the street from the Arizona Center mall. Would be nice to have free wifi in the room, but they do have it in the lobby. Overall a good hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average and cold”
Reviews.Author: BarneyO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to get to by car from Airport or major feeds into Phoenix. There is a signficant charge for parking in the undergound garrage. Lobby is very large, open, noisy and cold. Music plays loud most of the time, there are a lot of functions and side activities going on. Rooms are nice, but average in almost every way. The shower has curtains so flooding is a threat. The room I had was stuffy, I could smell the odour of the person who occupied the room prior to me. I found in the evening that the airconditioner was so cold that I had to switch it off. This then adds up, the room is stuffy as people turn the very cold air conditioner off! I spoke to the concierge about this and was advised this does not usually happen and may be because it was a cold spell and everyone was drawing on heat. No compensation or solution offered. Breakfast was average. There was little variety and what was there was either high in fat or sugar. Overall it is a good hotel, with some plus and some minus. I would check the alternatives if I was in Pheonix again but would not rule this out.

Reviews.Title: “Very delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: DelightedTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a week on business. The Sheraton Downtown was great. Very(!) comfortable beds, great workout room, very friendly and attentive staff, immaculate rooms, well lighted, good temperature control, good coffee, refrigerator (and no annoying minibar), and in-room safe. The wired internet was fast (and printing was available at a business center). I was particularly happy to see wired internet - the wireless that is becoming so ubiquitous is seldom fast enough to keep up with work. The parking garage was easily accessible and the parking slot sizes were decent. The workout room was very well furnished - ellipticals, treadmills, free weights, weight machines, mats and towels and earbud-headphones. (The lap pool is outdoors so it didn't appeal to me on a winter visit.) It was also very clean and well lighted. A good workout room is very important to me when I'm away like this for a week at a time. The location is very very good - walking distance to many restaurants. The view was terrific from my room. My only complaint is that the lobby is not well lit. I had trouble find the front desk - we came in quite late that first night. (funny- they had a little card from housekeeping, asking for a TripAdvisor review. Which I would do anyway. Guess that TripAdvisor is pretty well read now.)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay and great value”
Reviews.Author: euexplorer
Reviews.Content: The major selling point of this hotel is the staff. They were just so so friendly. Very welcoming. Just so willing to engage with you whenever they saw you. We got a lovely room on their excecutive floor. I am not sure how that happened as it was not requested but very much appreciated. Comfortable clean and a great few nights of sleep. It had just the best shower of any hotel I have ever been in. It is about a 5 minute walk right in to the middle of downtown and all the action. was great having the pool too with the temperature in phoenix in September. Breakfast was a bit basic but eveything else was first rate. Amazing value. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JoeBelli
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience here was great. I travel for a living and this is my first review. The entire staff here goes the extra mile. The food is great at the restaurant and room service. Matt Tobey at the main bar really cares about his customers and goes the extra mile. I would recommend this hotel to any business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Party”
Reviews.Author: WWPaci
Reviews.Content: We stayed downtown for a holiday party at Chase Filed. Many others also stayed at this hotel for the party. The staff was ready to accommodate a large number of guests checking in at the same time and processed the large volume quickly. The parking on the other hand was not as prepared as the front desk and was a bit of a disaster. We were backed up onto 3rd Street and they would not let you self park Picking up the car from valet was an even bigger disaster, 20 minute wait. We had cocktails in the District bar and the staff there was great. The room was nice, but not worth of 4 stars. The other 4 star hotel downtown, The Westin, was much nicer rooms for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Suprising extra touches”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this on the last night of my 3-night first stay here. This is a superb hotel, with plenty of the amenities one would expect, but sometimes find absent elsewhere. I was prompted to offer my feedback here because of a couple extra touches, though seemingly small, I found compelling. I appreciated their "make a green choice" option to forgo a day's housekeeping service - saving some energy - with the inducement to consider doing so a modest $5 gift card. Made me think twice about luxuriating in fresh linens & towels every day of my stay at the price of a bit deeper carbon footprint. Nice touch. The one I ended up really appreciating, I first took as being a little silly. Upon my arrival I was greeted warmly by all of the bellmen/valets at the portico. I was a bit bemused that each of the some five or so people offered their personal welcome the first time I entered. The first time I walked out, I was also bid a cheery good day by the then 7+ portico staff. OK, I thought. They all got the friendly face of service memo and are abiding by it. It was a pleasantly whimsical that they all said something cheerful upon my return a little later. Each conveying genuine good will, not rote repetition of a script. So, over the course of my three day stay, every darn time I walked in and out to and from my conference and related engagements - genuine, personable and unique greetings and farewells came forth from each of the no less that two bellmen/valets on duty. I have gone on at some length here describing seemingly simple acts to try and convey a sense of how out of the ordinary I found it. I'm an urban guy from a leading city, I interact with greeting and assistant staff all the time. These folks made me take unique notice that every interaction did not feel formulaic and lent a sense that we were all in on the friendly game. The rest of the hotel staff were excellent, but I have never been so pleasantly struck by the staff one is both the first and last to interact with. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location... Location.....But Not Adjacent!”
Reviews.Author: mauiman98
Reviews.Content: As I submit this review, the Sheraton Downtown has a rating on Trip Advisor of being #3 of the 176 hotels in Phoenix with 296 reviews and 4+1/2 (of 5) of the little circles filled in. That is pretty tall praise, IMO! And, after my recent stay at the Sheraton from 11-14 to 11-19-11, I am happy to pile on the praise! We booked a standard size room of 351 sq ft and it was exactly as described online only with a wonderful panoramic view of the city lights at night looking directly down the street toward the Convention Center and looking at the mountains in the distance during the daylight. Very nice! The king bed was comfy and "heavenly" as advertised. The bedding was comfortable too. I do not know the tread count. I did not like the pillows. Too soft for me. The bathroom was big enough to do the 3 s's that needed to be done. There was excellent lighting, good ventilation, and 5 feet of solid surface corian like countertop. We enjoyed good water pressure and hot enough water for showering every day, day or night, despite our 22nd floor location and the hotel being filled to capacity. The bathtub was equipped with a grab bar which is a great feature and a must have for all hotels who expect their guests to step over a bathtub wall to get into their shower. The stepover was 14 inches high. Yes, I measured it. The ledge of the bathtub was wide enough to hold most of the essentials for showering. I don't know if all rooms in this Sheraton are equipped with bathtubs. Do people actually use bathtubs when away on business? I'd prefer only a walk-in shower if given the choice. The shower curtain was clean and white. No mold. And I checked! The shower curtain was attached to a semicircular rod thingy which gives the showerer more space I think. I noticed a portable make-up mirror and wondered how many of those get packed up by guests during check out! The hair dryer was a powerful Conair Model 1875. The bathroom wall mirror over the vanity measured 37 inches wide and was 32 inches high! Nice! With side by sides on each side of it! This made me look thinner and made shaving easier, IMO! The wall mounted 35 inch flat screen LG brand HD TV provided vivid, sensational picture quality during the very few minutes that I spent actually watching it. I was tempted to try the pay per view movie feature but the ones I wanted to see were $19.95! Even the porn movies were priced that high! The room had no closet. Instead, there was a massive wardrobe that came equipped with 10 high quality removeable hangers that easily took care of our hanging up needs and there were a few tiny shelves inside it that were barely big enough to hold a single shoe ! The iron and ironing board were stowed away inside this. I found the bible in there too! A big plus of the room was the 5 feet of desk work space and a comfy padded desk chair. The room had plenty of light and it came equipped with a small refrigerator, a safe that was actually big enough to hold my laptop, and a single 12oz cup coffee maker with yummy bold blend Africa Kitamu (Starbuck's) coffee which was delicious and not offered in the hotel's District Restaurant or in the Internet Cafe. The coffeemaker must be a special made for Sheraton device. It was easy to fill with water and the prepackaged single cup of coffee bag . It took just a few minutes to perk. Our entire room had only 2 drawers for storage. They were located on the bottom of that huge wardrobe that I mentioned previously so they were hard to reach without deep knee bends. The carpet was a basic business hotel quality neutral color no padding carpet. It was kept clean. My feet had no tell tale black after walking around barefoot. There was a big stain on the carpet in my room from a previous spill of some kind. Sheraton management should take care of this because it is an eyesore and it gets viewed immediately as you open the door. The mountain view out the window more than compensated for this, IMO, but carpet stains leave an impression. The Sheraton Hotel is new and beautiful.
