The public spaces, especially the lobby, were grand with unique artwork and light fixtures everywhere you looked . Its location downtown is an easy 2 block walk to the Convention Center. It is NOT located adjacent to the Convention Center as is described in descriptions that you can find at www.sheraton.com and at www.expedia.com. It is across the street from the Arizona Center. The Arizona Center was a delightful surprise! A destination all by itself! We enjoyed dining in a different restaurant there each night of our Sheraton stay. Strolling around the shops and the courtyards and fountains was a nice get away from convention business. The 4th floor heated rooftop pool and hot tub at the Sheraton were a nice touch but I never got the chance to use either one. The 24 hour open exercise room also on the 4th floor looked to have all the right gear for working up a good sweat. I didn't use that either. I did use the bar on the 4th floor rooftop. But they served drinks there in plastic cups because of the swimming pool, so I didn't stay long. Margaritas never taste good to me served up in plastic. I did use the high speed internet accessed computers and printer that are set up for Sheraton guests in the Link Cafe located off the lobby on the ground floor. They serve beer and wine and cheese and fruit plates there. You can also use the internet access available in your hotel room, but for an additional price! I think it was $12.95 for 24 hrs, wired or wireless. If this arrangement works to save money... great. But....not having internet in the room is a big inconvenience. I had no problem using the Cafe's computers. I convinced myself that I was saving $12.95 off my room bill, but was I....really? The Sheraton Staff were impressive. They got the message about customer service. I received smiles and eye contact from everyone. Nobody was too busy to offer me help or courtesy. Maybe it has something to do with the perfect weather that downtown Phoenix enjoyed during our stay! And I do mean perfect. Sunny, clear, 70's......c'mon! You just cannot be cranky when the weather is perfect. Phoenix weather is ideal in late November. I want to give special mention to Yoel and to Maria of the Sheraton's housekeeping staff of the 22nd floor. Always smiling.....always helpful! Thank you both! I also want to thank District Restaurant bartender Jerry who let me sample some California Cabernet that he sells to unsuspecting guests for $17.00 a glass. It was delicious but well outside my price range for a casual glass of red with a burger! And to all who staffed the concierge desk during our visit. Thank you too for being always polite and always helpful. The downtown Sheraton and room 2216 met our every need for comfort and convenience during a 4 night business stay. Lack of drawer space made for a lot of clutter. This might be an issue for a businessman or woman with a need to store stuff out of sight. There was also no shelves or drawers in the bathroom so bath stuff got deposited all over the 5 feet of vanity. This made for more clutter and might be a problem for neat freaks. You know who you are! The location of the Sheraton was perfect. I never needed or wanted to drive anywhere. The Arizona Center is right across the street and provides shopping, many restaurants and eateries, and a big multiplex movie theater. Had I rented a car, parking at the Sheraton would have cost me an additional $17.00/night for self parking and $25.00 to splurge on valet. . Some tips- Take the Supershuttle Bus from the airport to save money. We paid $14.00/pp for the short, 1 way ride to the Sheraton. We had to wait 10 minutes for it. Others who were impatient jumped into a limo. They got charged $35.00 (for 2) and left a $5.00 tip. They got 2 bottles of cold water to enjoy and had their bags taken care of. And they got a restaurant tip too! For where to find the tastiest lamb kabobs in town! Well worth the extra dollars, IMO, but the restaurant turned out to be a $40.00 cab fare away (one way)!. Speaking of restaurants, here is a tip - you can save money by eating at the Wine Bar in the District Restaurant at the Sheraton. They have a nice variety of bar food. A tasty cheeseburger was priced right at $10.00 and they stay open until 2AM. BTW, the same menu served at the Wine Bar is provided for guests wanting room service, which is available for late night dining from 11PM to 6AM. A great convenience, especially for us jet lagged East Coasters. More tips- In The Arizona Center- try The Corner Bakery Cafe for both breakfast and lunch. Free wi-fi and fair prices try Mi Amigos Mexican Grill. Stays open late, which, in downtown Phoenix, means until 10PM. Try the blue margaritas which were priced at 2 for $5.00 on the night we partied there. Try the 1130 Restaurant- order an 8th Street Ale and the Citrus Tilapia entree served with a fresh orange glaze that was to die for. I begged in vain for the recipe. Try the My Big Fat Greek Restaurant-ask for a table overlooking the fountains. Beautiful at night. They will accept Restaurant dot com certificates too! Please tell Ricardo that the old Mauiman sent you!. Last tip. Look for the "Ambassadors" on the streets near the convention center. Usually on bicycles, they will provide ideas for restaurants and clubs in the Downtown Area and may have coupons for these places at savings of 20% off the entire bill. . I hope you enjoyed my review of the Sheraton in Downtown Phoenix. I want to return tomorrow! Thet are offering rooms for $99.00 over the Holidays. If only the airlines would cooperate. LOL! BTW, look for my post about the things that I din't do and wanted to do while visiting Phoenix on The Phoenix Forum. Happy Holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but great location!”
Reviews.Author: MartySmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a convention in November. The room seemed small and the view was nothing spectacular. Staff was excellent, very friendly and helpful. Free room WIFI would have been nice, seems like if super 8 can do it, why not Sheraton. Guess that was our only complaint. The location was fantastic, close to lots of places to eat and the convention center. A few more shopping locations and it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “This was a nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Southern2rs
Reviews.Content: From the front desk to the bellman, I was treated like a King.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: william m
Reviews.Content: I'm a computer consultant and travel about 45 weeks out of every year and this is one of my top rated hotels. The staff goes out of there way to make you feel at home and help you with anything you need. The area is nice there is a movie theater across the street along with more restaurants then you could every hope to eat at. Overall the best hotel I've stayed out in over ten years of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Sunny,Smiles”
Reviews.Author: darlene m
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many times, and each time the experience is the same: wonderful. Smiles wherever you go, excellent service (Adrienne is a personel favorite), crisp clean rooms. To borrow a famous line, I'LL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: AnnieInVirginia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times for business - it's located right in downtown and walking distance to the convention center. The restaurant is quite good, and has a nice breakfast buffet. There are some restaurants and shops across the street, as well as a movie theatre. Phoenix is a spread out place so if you want to explore be sure to have a car.

Reviews.Title: “An upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackc1212
Reviews.Content: This hotel is downtown Phoenix with access to many attractions. Across the street is the Arizona Center with many places to eat. Museums are within walking distance. The area is not busy even during the week. The hotel is comfortable and offers a great breakfast. Parking and internet access are costly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Downtown Phoenix is one of the nicest Hotels in the USA. The staff and sevices provided are exceptional. Tracey Simmons was the very best at customer service, nice, polite and very friendly and knowledgable about the Hotel and the area.Willdefinitely recommend the Hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Elvis4vr
Reviews.Content: Attended the ASCP convention at the convention center. Several meetings also held in Sheraton rooms. Staff met every need for our meetings. DId not eat in the hotel, too many choices just across the street. Beds were exceptionally comfortable, and the rooms were spacious. I liked the dual elevators where one set of four handled the lower floors and the other set of four handled the upper floors. I couldn't get a shuttle pickup at the airport, but the taxi ride of $15 was reasonable. Sheraton did have a return shuttle to the airport for $12, that left every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “IFMA Convention”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: Great experience with this hotel, nice, friendly staff. Excellent service and treatment of visitors, has a "welcome home" feel about it. I would highly recommend this hotel to others whether staying for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “"Top Flight Stay"”
Reviews.Author: Goesoutalot
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by the quality and service at the downtown Phoenix Sheraton. The room was immaculate with exceptional appointments. All contact with personnel was very pleasant and even the "banquet food" at our meeting was prepared well and decent quality. One block from the convention center and would strongly recommend for a downtown Phoenix stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Phoenix Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane L
Reviews.Content: The clerks at the front desk were very helpful. The hotel is upscale, the rooms are clean, and the food is delicious. Close to Chase Field, the Convention Center, restaurants, and shops means that you don't need to rent a car. You will enjoy the hotel workout room and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Completely appalled”
Reviews.Author: srwohnam
Reviews.Content: I am a gold member of starwoods rewards program and upon my stay was granted access to the "club lounge" area of the hotel. I had frequented it during my stay but on my day of departure I was completely taken aback by the service in the lounge area today. I visited it today (11/18) at about 11:30 in an attempt to get a cold bottle of water and a quite place to relax after working out in the hotel gym (which was excellent). Upon entering I was greeted by a young woman in a suit, a girl who looked much too young to be managing a VIP area, and an african american gentlemen (and I use the term "gentleman" as lightly as possible) in a brown apron. They acknowledged me as I walked in, but that was about it. I received a warm bottle of water and a cold shoulder. I sat down on the couch to relax and watch tv, but was unable to enjoy my time there on account of their loud conversation. I couldn't relax. They were loud, rude, and the male was using profanity. They then proceeded to disappear into a room for several minutes. Other guests entered, in need of service, yet the employees remained in the room despite other VIP's entering. They were confused and also very unhappy at the lack of service they received. The experience was very unfortunate considering the rest of my stay was fantastic. I am just not sure why they would employ such rude people to a VIP lounge

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Phoenix is GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nate M
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton traveler through and through...that said, I ended up in Phoenix staying at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown and am now only booking with Sheraton. The hotel is very clean and the entire staff was willing and able to help in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Antonio B
Reviews.Content: I recently had to travel to Phoenix and elected to stay at the Sheraton Downtown. A wondeful location, accessible to everything and the hotel staff was exceptional in every contact I had with them, from the minute we arrived, all during the five days of my stay. Although on business I was made to feel like I was home. The staff went way out of their way to accommodate my reguest and lastly, the facilities are terrific. I plan on returning to the Phoenix area and I will be returning to the Sheraton Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Usu T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just wonderful! The staff is very friendly. Our room was on the 23rd floor and we had a great view of Downtown Phoenix. The pool and fitness Center are great. There are good restaurants in the hotel and also more across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Sheraton in October, 2011. Hotel is very modern. Green efforts are outstanding. Hotel restaurant is top notch. Hotel room are very clean, modern and the window views are great of the mountains. Beds are very comfy. Will definitely stay here again. Great for business travelers. All hotel staff were accomodating and willing to assist with any questions/issues. Lots of dining options within 2-3 blocks from hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRB54
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels stays I've had. Great staff, great beds, awesome fitness area, everything is clean, in a good area, friendly staff, and close to many eating choices right across the street. Convention center is only a block and a half away. Sheraton obviously has spent time teaching their staff the rewards from having great customer service. Thanks for the awesome lodging!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mnurda
Reviews.Content: Sam in the lobby bar was awesome. Thx for making our stay fun

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jefferey c
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is really good. The housekeeper who kept my room clean and stocked was an amazing lady. She was extremely attentive to my needs and I appreciated her attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Stay”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a good location and the staff is so friendly. Close to food and dining and located right down the street from the ocnvention center. The view of the mountains from my room was beautiful and the sunrise in the morning was breath taking. The hotel amenities are wonderful including the workout area and the pool and most importantly all the latest safety features such as fire alarm and fire sprinklers. Overall great place for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for convention center”
Reviews.Author: SandraK6411
Reviews.Content: Rooms were well appointed and hotel staff courtesy and friendly. Breakfast room service was fast, even without ordering the night before. Excellent housekeeping, pool/bar staff and the valets were extremely helpful (offering water while we waited).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel filled with extraordinary staff.”
Reviews.Author: MikeFromKC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Sheraton hotels over the years. I had a certain expectation for them. Lately, I've noticed the brand has intentionally improved on their properties and service. The Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel must be their crown jewel! The architecture was beautiful. The facility was very well maintained. Every staff person I came in contact with was friendly, polite and helpful. I did not eat there so I can't comment on the food. It's not really a place for kids. It's just a great business class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyboi31
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel early this year. the hotel is beautiful! the gym is HUGE and really, really nice... lots of space between equipment, cold water available, music, etc. the pool is great for laps (long and narrow) and the deck area around the pool is lovely (though a little hot during the afternoon heat, but that's phoenix). the staff serving drinks at the pool bar were very friendly. the doormen and front desk staff were professional and eager to help. the breakfast buffet was fantastic. the location is good because: 1) there is a small movie/shopping plaza across the street with some great restaurants and 2) especially if you don't have a car, since the tram/bus station is only a block away, making it easy to get to shopping areas of phoenix/tempe etc. the rooms are VERY nice, if a little small. the beds are like big marshmallows, so comfy! the only complaint is that all morning long the housekeeping staff would let the neighboring room's doors SLAM shut CONSTANTLY while they go in and out of the rooms (ie. back and forth from their cart in/out of room). i found this to be ridiculous and a huge nuisance for an otherwise great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Phoenix- Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LindaKarp
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel is a new (relatively) and beautiful addition to the Sheraton properties. It has everything you want in a hotel stay! Beautiful place, terrific amenities and the staff is incredible. From the minute we walked in we were made to feel special. Need something? They'll make it happen. I was here for a conference, but my husband joined me because we were continuing on, and he had a marvelous time here as well. There was a glitch in some planning, and the hotel bent over backwards to make it right! And then paid for our cab ride to the airport! WOW! Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: littleeve
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a PhD residency program at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel, and was lucky enough to be able to stay there as well. The room was very clean, well appointed, and very comfortable. The best part of the stay was the staff - the ENTIRE staff. Everyone was genuinely pleasant and helpful. If I ever return to Phoenix, this is where I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice .... but PRICEY”
Reviews.Author: MrFoster
Reviews.Content: Equisitely designed and furnished hotel in the heart of downtown Phoenix. (Unfortunately, the heart of Phoenix is barely beating, and goes into cardiac arrest every day after 4PM ... but I digress ..... ) It is conveniently located next to the Convention Center, but little else of interest. The staff is friendly and courteous. The rooms are very quiet, very clean, and spacious. The beds make you feel like you are sleeping on fluffy clouds. Be forewarned: Not only are the rooms expensive, the hotel further gouges you by charging $12+/day for internet connection - which I find akin to airline baggage fee rip-offs. The food and drinks in the hotel are also outrageously expensive. They only brief relief from the price gouging is during happy hour. The gift shop pricing is nothing less than retail ransom - and there is no other place within a mile to buy snacks, toiletries or sundries.

Reviews.Title: “A Business Travelers Delight”
Reviews.Author: CWimer62
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in downtown Phoenix. Superb and friendly staff. Extremely clean. Lots of common area. Great bar and the restaurant is very, very good with a decent menu. The rooms are comfortable but average in size. I'd highly recommend for business. But I think the rooms are a little small for a couple looking a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: suziieq3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown during a business trip. It is a convention style hotel, but very accommodating and even with many large groups, the staff maintained excellent service. We had no problems with housekeeping, and everyone was extremely responsive to our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: gharbor1
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with walking distance to convention center and several downtown Phoenix attractions. Beds have a memory foam type mattess. Some people love it, others feel like they are sinking into a hole. Service was outstanding. Self parking was $17 a night. Internet was $12.95 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Busy convention style hotel”
Reviews.Author: joannetravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a large, busy, down town convention style hotel. While we were there, there were events going on and people checking in in large groups.Very hectic. Quality of room was very nice, but the housekeeping staff forgot to turn the alarm clock off and that was annoying when trying to sleep in on a Sunday morning. We also heard voices from the hall, so that was not great. When I called customer service about the alarm clock, they were not empathetic at all--I got a brief-sorry-- so I asked to speak to the manager who was very good about it and said he would speak to the housekeeping manager to remind staff to turn off the alarms in rooms where guests had checked out. He also gave us a food credit, which was very nice of him. On a Sunday afternoon, the restaurant was dead, but service was still very slow. There was less than a skeleton staff on, and it would have been better to close the restaurant than have such slow service. Pool is a lap pool and by mid afternoon loses the sun. The design is poor as the pool is close to a wall, so lounges are only on one side, and very crowded and the wall also blocks the views. Fitness centre is large and looked well equipped. They have a internet cafe, with free internet and this was excellent. Arizona Center is across the street, and has a number of restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: swimmer_4664
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown for five nights, at the end of October. The service in the hotel was simply first class. As I stepped out of the taxi, a hotel attendent approached the taxi driver to take the bags which I was told would be taken directly to my room. The check-in was fast and effecient and the bags arrived in my room within minutes. The room was attractive, very clean and the bed really comfortable. My room was on the sixth floor and I couldn't hear a sound from elsewhere. I liked the pool and the fitness centre and used both each day. Housekeeping was responsive to the one request I made and all the public areas, fitness centre etc. were exceptionally clean. The concierge and the hotel attentents could not have been more helpful with advice about local amenities, restaurants etc. I was provided with print outs of transit routes, shopping and restaurant recommendations. I had a problem with a computer in the business centre and an assistant came immediately to resolve the issue. I ordered room service one night, the food arrived quickly, was tasty and well presented. The meal was also piping hot which is not always the case when ordering room service. I have to say I have stayed in many Sheratons in Europe, Canada and the USA and without doubt this is the finest service I have experienced. There were several large conferences during the time I stayed at the hotel and yet the service level never faltered. Whenever I was in the elevator with a staff member they enquired how things were going, was I enjoying my stay etc. The whole Sheraton Team are to be commended. I am quite a picky traveller with admittedly high standards but the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown was without fault. I have no hesitation is recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel...Customer Service+”
Reviews.Author: TDK1009
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here at a conference. All the staff from the valet/bell men to the restaurant were extremely well-trained in customer service. Hat's off to the people who spent the time preparing their people. This kind of service doesn't happen in every department by accident. (Well done) There is a movie theatre with 24 screens literally across the street. Very accessible to things. Gift shop had a nice assortment of items from necessity (chapstick) to fun things to take home to the family. They had Coke vending machines...Love my Diet Coke. Would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Brionne S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in downtown Phoenix and the Sheraton is simply the best! When you walk into the lobby, you are amazed by the high-ceilings, marble floors, and open floor plan where a lobby bar is conveniently located. The guest rooms are very comfortable and clean. The fitness center and pool invite you in for a great workout. There is also a nice restaurant in the hotel as well as several right across the street at the Arizona Center. This hotel is not only very welcoming but is also perfectly situated in the heart of downtown Phoenix and is within walking distance of so many restaurants, offices, etc. I highly recommend you check into this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line Service!”
Reviews.Author: Rob R
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave, the service in this hotel is top notch! I have never had a better hotel experience. The front desk staff makes you feel like a VIP the minute you walk up to the desk. They go out of their way to assist you with your every need. I so appreciate their willingness to give me an end room every time I request it. The rooms are modern, clean and inviting. The bed is the best feature, however; it's like sleeping on a cloud. I stay at this Sheraton on a regular basis, and I've never had a bad experience in over two years. It is my hotel of choice when in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Better than average convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: sschu
Reviews.Content: This is a new, high-rise downtown convention hotel. The rooms are well furnished and comfortable. They could use a bit more storage. The fitness center and pool area are excellent. There is a nice internet cafe in the lobby. Service staff were friendly and capable. My only complaint was that when we pulled in to the arrival area, we were told that the attendant did not think there was any self-park space available, so we had to use the valet service. That proved not to be the case, so we were out a few dollars each day. The restaurant looked good. The location is right in the middle of the arts and sports section of the city. It is across from the Arizona Center which has lots of restaurants. The concierge service was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is first rate!”
Reviews.Author: joe K
Reviews.Content: Britney greets you with a smile every morning at the District Restaurant. Ashley M. the server was very friendly and attentiveness to our needs. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a convenient setting”
Reviews.Author: storm3r
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two different weeks in the past month so I am starting to feel like a regular here. The hotel itself is quite large with over 1000 rooms and some nice open spaces. They have a full-service restaurant and three nice bars on the premises of which one of them has an after-work happy hour wine tasting each day where many people seem to congregate. There is also a small coffee shop in the area of the public access computers where anyone can jump online and surf the internet. As for the rooms they were modern and felt pretty new. I worked out of my hotel room on some evenings and found the internet access to work good with little lag on both wired and wireless access. The rooms also had a small fridge and a single serve coffee machine with Starbucks brand coffee provided. On days where I had time, I utilized the gym on the 4th floor. For a hotel gym it was really nice and had a lot of equipment. If you walked out onto the deck off the gym they had a pool that was long enough to lap swim for exercise as well as a nice pool bar (although it was not open sometimes when I was out there). The location of the hotel in downtown Phoenix was great. Across the street is the Arizona Center with some shopping and a bunch of restaurants. Also one block away is the convention center and approximately 3 blocks away is Chase field and the USAirways center. Next door seemed to be a playhouse and the kid's museum was also really close. I ended up walking all over downtown and nothing really seemed that far away however the whole time I was at the hotel they had bike taxis (kind of like a tuk tuks) waiting outside to take you on a tour or anywhere you needed to go. If I was to knock anything about my stay it would probably be the price of room service (pricey even compared to other places I stay) however this was not a big deal since my meals were reimbursed and the food was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Brian L
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days there for a conference and the hotel was great. Every single person I ran into was professional and literally nice. (Coming from Philly it was a culture shock) The hotel is great, a quick ride to/from the airport, the food was good, Michael the bartender from IL gave us a great experience when we were celebrating our successful meetings and stayed until he was closing - he never made us feel unwelcome. Even the guys helping with bags were pleasant, helpful and added to the experience. The front desk staff was attentive and worked quickly to get us through checkin/out. The facility itself is great and the gym is well above expectations for a hotel facility. Cannot recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: cindy l
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the MLB All Star game in July....great location and a wonderful hotel. The service was exceptional, and all hotel staff friendly and very accommodating. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Amy D
Reviews.Content: I have recently started to visit Phoenix for business quite a bit. I have selected the Sheraton in Phoenix downtown as my hotel of choice for a few key reasons... 1. It's brand new and very chique and clean. 2. Easy access to the freeway. 3. Great food. But, bottom line is it's great for me as a business traveler. The staff are friendly and helpful which is welcomed for an avid business travel away from family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “District Bar & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Japgar
Reviews.Content: Overall the staff here is friendly, helpful and all around great. A special shout out to my new friends at District Bar; Carrie Watson, Sam Maples & especially Matt Tobey. These folks made my stay here GREAT & a lot of FUN!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, beautiful hotel & impressive service!!”
Reviews.Author: baby888
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this hotel. Right from the moment we arrived until the time we departed, this hotel was very impressive. The valet guys outside are all so professional, friendly and prompt. Quick check-in. Nice room, large bathroom, great housekeeping. Soda and ice machine on our floor (the 24th floor has a wonderful view). Felt very safe in the hotel and it's surrounding areas (a very important factor for me). Went to a Dbacks game at Chase Field, close enough to walk, but took a pedicab across the street as I was travelling with my dad. Had room service twice, prompt and friendly service, great food (love the oven-baked tomato soup). Ate at the restaurant downstairs 3 times, very nice atmosphere, great service and food (love the cotton candy for dessert). Large git shop in the lobby (bought snacks and souvenirs there). The Link coffee shop downstairs is nice, also used the computer and printer there as well. Pool area is nice, clean and well stocked with towels, friendly staff there as well. Large gym area as well. Close to Downtown Scottsdale for some great shopping as well. This hotel is literally 5 minutes from the airport which is so convenient. I found this hotel to be luxurious, comfortable and left me with the feeling that I can't wait to return!! Great service throughout the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Event & stay was great”
Reviews.Author: VickieLM
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel in September for a 3 day event. I required some assistance upon my arrival; the front desk and the bell desk was sympathetic & Shawn got what I needed immediatley. I love the fact that there's a Starbucks on site. Oh, check out the pool on the roof. I got up early to stretch and enjoyed a quiet view of the sunrise. The restaurant service was excellent & we enjoyed the food too. There's another Starbucks & some great small restaurants across the street if you want to leave the hotel. Vickie M.

Reviews.Title: “Clean! Clean! Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel to watch a sport event at Chase Field. The beds are so comfy and the hotel is so clean. I am very picky about this. The food was great and the location is within walking distance we canceled our rental car. The only negative was when we called down to the front desk and they couldn't tell us where the best place was to eat and watch sports. We figured it out-lots of restaurants around including the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: B H
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk and Concierge Service was exceptional during my recent stay at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel. They were extremely helpful and went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied. I would definitely stay at the Sheraton Phoenix again when I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Stay - GM Mr. Percopo is a true man of Hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: WillAudrey
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton Phoenix 2 weeks ago for 3 nights. From the time I checked in on a Tuesday afternoon and my departure on Friday morning I was treated by pleasent greetings with smiling faces. Every associate seemed very sincere about wanting to help me out. I felt it a necessity to ask someone why everyone was so friendly and kind. The comment back was it was a reflection of our leardership beginning and ending with our GM Mr. Leo Percopo. Besides feelilng like a king the hotel public areas and the rooms were very clean. The hotel is also very convenient to the main freeway system that leads you to all points in the Valley of the Sun. I intend on staying there again on my next visit to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Kristen Brown was incredible!”
Reviews.Author: TKCooper
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sheraton Phoenix for a conference and concierge Kristen Brown was incredibly helpful. She went above and beyond with every request and made our first time in Phoenix the best! Her customer service skills were above par and she went out of her way to make you feel like a VIP. Great job Kristen! And thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Brooke, My Phoenix Angel”
Reviews.Author: Jean David D
Reviews.Content: I felt as if i was about to have a heart attack when I arrived at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel and could not find my wallet. I informed Brooke of what happened and before I could even say help, Brooke contacted the shuttle Bus Company and Delta Airlines. Lamount was another individual who made my stay worthwhile. He too went above and beyond to make sure that other staff members knew of my situation. Brooke's attention to detail and quick response led Delta to return my call. My wallet was found and returned to me that same night. Thank you my Phoenix Angel.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel stays!”
Reviews.Author: S F
Reviews.Content: My company held its annual conference at this hotel and I must say...it was the best accommodations that I have had in Phoenix for a conference in a LONG time. I was greeted warmly by all the staff I encountered. Check-in was smooth and uneventful. The front desk personnel was friendly and accommodating. I had brought gift bags for some of my co-workers staying there and for a small fee, delivered each gift bag to each recipient's room after check-in. The beds, linens, and pillows were divine. Better sleep there than at home! I was shocked. The room was elegant, yet contemporary. The bathroom amenities were top shelf. I really enjoyed the orange lotion. The towels were fluffy. Room service was excellent and efficient. The poolside service was great. Not too much attention, but just enough. The cocktails were awesome (but quite pricey). I didn't visit the fitness center, but I heard that it was great. What I really appreciated was that if you opted out of maid service, you were given a $5 off coupon to use at their restaurant or room service. For someone that doesn't like housekeeping poking around my room, it worked great for me. If you want clean towels or extra lotion/soap/etc., you just called for it and they would deliver. The "coffee bar" was awesome, but not necessary if you like brewed coffee. The room coffee was AWESOME. The bell service was quick and efficient. The ambience of the entire hotel was bright and open and despite all the marble, it was not "cold". The conference area was easily accessible from the rooms, so you didn't have to walk a mile to get to your meetings. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and hope to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: tonyj614
Reviews.Content: I have an office in Phoenix and I travel there quite a bit for business and events. Truth be told, I've never been a big fan of Phoenix because of the heat and the brown landscape (117 degrees is 117 degrees, dry heat or not) but my recent stay at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown was by far the best. I was greeted immediately by not one but two valets when I pulled up. The friendly young man at the registration desk made a point to come out from behind the desk to greet me personally. That may have been a function of having no queue but still a class move. I was given a promotion that tripled my rewards points, told where everything was, when everything was available and how to get there (I was on an executive floor that required special access). The room was everything i expected and I was fortunate to have a good view of what I consider a pretty boring landscape; all flat, all brown and then beautiful mountains (all with unique names) jutting up out of the flatness. I gained a different appreciation for the Airzona landscape in that room. I went green and declined maid service everyday for which i was given a voucher for a discount on future stays which was new to me. I don't require fresh linens or towels as I am the only to use them and i'm not in town for long so I thought that was a very smart option to give eco-conscious travelers. I was there for a business summit so the meeting accomodations were top notch but the highlight of my stay by far was an awesome bartender at the lounge bar, Carrie. She was just a trainee but she was attentive, she was friendly, had a smile to die for and someone I would go back to the Sheraton just to see. She told me where I could find funs things to do while I was in town, talked sports and laughed at my awful jokes. I would be remiss if I didn't mention her trainer, Matt (I hope that's his name) because he was great too. Cheers, Carrie and Matt :) Carrie, Matt, the rest of the staff and the world class service all amounted to a memerable stay at a classy hotel in a city for which I have a new found love. If I'm within 50 miles of Pheonix, the Sheraton Downtown is the only place I'll stay. Thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your business here!”
Reviews.Author: Kipp2525
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of having roughly a half dozen work events held at this hotel and it truly does feel like home away from home. They anticipate your needs with world class effort. I work for a company that conducts several large scale trainings per year and with as complex and stressful as these can be, the folks at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel make them go as smoothly as I could ever wish for. This is truly the best property we've ever had an event at and I look forward to being able to bring business back to them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: heap6
Reviews.Content: Boasts that it is the largest hotel in Arizona and it certainly is big with a cavernous foyer/reception area. Despite this, the building is very easy to navigate having at least three separate elevator shafts. The rooms are well appointed, large and spotlessly clean. Fresh bottles of chilled water are provided daily. The staff are unfailingly helpful, their attentiveness humanising this great monolith. From check-in to departure, four nights later, they were cheerful pleasant courteous and always eager to be of assistance. The place is also exceptionally well managed, all its services running faultessly It is situated in downtown Phoenix which at its best is dreary and at its worst so empty of people you wonder if you've slept through some disaster. However, I'd not only return to this hotel but look forward to doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: TrishB31
Reviews.Content: Came here for a business stay and was impressed! Big, open entry way, clean, nice rooms, super helpful staff (bell service, front desk, room service) and delish food to choose from when getting room service (even at 10pm!). Nothing is more annoying than getting into a hotel late and having two un-inspired sandwiches to choose from. They had tons of options - but I had baked tomato soup with fontina cheese and croutons as well as the spinach salad with strawberries, roasted beets, almonds, and goat cheese. So good. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff & Property!”
Reviews.Author: steph508
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel! The bars, lounge, restaurants, rooms, pool, everything is great. The location is across the street from the Arizona Center, a block from the convention center, and a short walk to CityScape. The best aspect of the hotel - the staff is amazing! From checkin to the wonderful bell hop who gave us water for the ride to the airport. The only drawback is boring downtown Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “What a great property”
Reviews.Author: Mystelody
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and would definitely stay again. The hotel is clean, spacious, has great amenities (nice pool, relatively big and well equipped gym for a hotel, biz center/cafe) and the decor is modern and rich. The staff were courteous and attentive, without trying too hard; and reminded me of what professional customer service should look like. The bar area has a huge and beautiful lounge with friendly happy hour prices and it felt like such a waste with just a handful of people enjoying it. But then again, we visited on a quiet (no convention) weekend when August temperatures were 103+. It was as if we were in a ghost town (just a beautiful one lined with palm trees). Hardly a soul in sight and it felt like we pretty much had the restaurant (and generally that part of downtown) to ourselves. There is a large AMC theater across the street and we were able to catch a late night movie. There was also a city shuttle offering free rides so we got to enjoy a mini tour of downtown. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary service”
Reviews.Author: Roger D
Reviews.Content: Great service. Room was spacious and well thought out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Mooline
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a two night stay at this hotel. Views from the 28th floor are spectacular. Service was outstanding - every employee went out of his or her way to make me feel like a valued guest. Rooms are surprisingly small, but very clean and well appointed. I was in a corner, with only one room adjacent, making for a quiet and comfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business visits, friendly, & professional services!”
Reviews.Author: Bojarelli
Reviews.Content: Overall, my week-long stay during work here was great. The staff always had a friendly smile to welcome you and were always quite helpful with answering your questions. Gym was excellent with machines and even free-weights to use. Pool was awesome morning/noon/night. Internet use within the rooms were excellent. Internet access for the conference rooms could have been better by allowing similar access we had from our rooms. But I guess that's business for ya? Perhaps if they revamped their package-deal of FREE Wifi w/rental of the business conference rooms, it would further convince other businesses to visit here? Seemed pricey with the wifi-access for the conference rooms, if you asked me. Was forced to visit my room w/my laptop just to check emails then return to the conference room we rented to finish-up the rest of my work. Even if the Business Center was available, it would have been a nice gesture of the hotel to just INCLUDE a FREE Wifi package to all our users during the week-long rental of one of their conference rooms. That was the only NEGATIVE review I had for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, convenient, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: T G D
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice, and modern. Beds, pillows and bedding were very relaxing to sleep on and we always woke up feeling well rested. The staff was very kind and accommodating. It was very nice of them to give us bottled water when we went outdoors to brave the scorching Phoenix 110+ degree heat. Lamont and and the bellhop staff rock. They are very kind and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and had a spectacular view of the downtown and surrounding area. You must dine at the hotel restaurant at least once, because they prepare delicious wholesome meals. For all you Aveda salon fans, there is a full service Aveda salon and spa called Perry Monge salon about a 3 min walk - very convenient and excellent service. Lots of other attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the hotel. I rarely givea full 5 stars for hotels that do not offer free internet or free parking (I used neither), but this hotel made up for it with everything else. The service, restaurant, gym, and room were wonderful. I found the air conditioning to be too cold and at the time of my stay it was 115F+ outside. Turning down the AC made the room perfect. Room was nicely decorated and with a warm and modern touch. Safe and mini-fridge was available for use. The bed was comfortable and the number of available television channels were more than sufficient. The part of the hotel I was most impressed with was the gym. 20+ cardio machines, free weights, and lots of weight machines with lots of floor space. The treadmills even have the option to work with your ipod/iphone for nike+. For those travelers who like to stay active while traveling, this gym offers more than most local gyms without the people. The pool area was also nice. The hotel restaurant was not overly priced and the food was pretty good. There are lots of other restaurant options across the street. The location of this hotel is pretty good for downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingsoundie
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel and it shows. Very comfortable rooms for an extended business stay. We had multiple rooms for multiple nights and it was great. Restaurants and Starbucks across the road. Staff were fantastic - nothing was a trouble. High recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Lauradd29
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Sheraton in Downtown Phoenix. The room was very nice-new furniture and clean. The front desk staff was helpful and courtious. I would not hesitate to stay here again. The bed is very soft...too soft for my comfort but if you like a very soft mattress this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible help during emergency!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton during a conference in early August and the second night I came down with a horrible stomach virus. When things seemed to be getting severe, we contacted the main desk and requested help for how to get to a hospital since we did not have a car. They immediately sent up a couple security guys, Kyle Miller and I think, Brian.... Anyway, under the most awkward of circumstances, these guys were just awesome! They really took care of us. Called for emergency help, got a wheel chair, and were just there to help in whatever way we needed. They did not push themselves on us, but gave us options, were incredibly, and I mean incredibly, respectful and sensitive. Just really can't say enough. We went to the ER and they sent the hotel car to pick us up when we needed to return. Of course, this all started after midnight and we needed to return several hours later. They were available to us after we returned, if needed, and even had gingerale and toast waiting in our room upon our return. Really, everyone at this hotel was very kind to us throughout this ordeal. The next day or two as I recooped in the room, the staff was available to help with a service or refrain, and our request for more gingerale was quickly met. They kindly inquired how I was doing, including the security staff making a followup call later the next day to check on us. The attention we received was appropriate and appreciated. Thank you, Kyle, Brian, and everyone at Sheraton for making a very unpleasant situation into something we won't forget in a good way - for the professional and personal way in which you came to our aid!

Reviews.Title: “We love the service”
Reviews.Author: Elbia M
Reviews.Content: Exellent service!..... especially two of the "house keeping" ladies! their names are Elena Fernandez and Silvia Fernandez. We have been in this hotel for about 1 month and a half and I have had the opportunity to change rooms and floor but we have said "no" because we want to stay in these floor and this room because of their exellent service(Elena and Silvia)!. We are very thankfull to you Sheraton because of your exellent service! and very nice staff!.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly business”
Reviews.Author: Randy G
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights in mid-August on a business trip. This hotel basically gears itself for the business crowd and does a perfectly adequate job at meeting their needs. The rooms are your standard Sheraton rooms with somewhat dated and worn furniture, but still perfectly serviceable (though the air conditioning doesn't get very cold, which some people may dislike). They have free parking in an underground garage, so that was a nice touch. Though I am a Starwood Platinum member, they did not upgrade me to a suite even though the hotel did not seem particularly booked to me, so that's a minus in my book. They did give me access to the club, however. The club is a little small, but they have a decent continental breakfast spread every morning and the light appetizers they put out during dinner time were quite tasty and filling. All in all, I wouldn't mind staying here again but I might be inclined to try a different hotel in the area to see what they have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: momonbusiness
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a conference. I enjoyed the hotel: nice rooms, great outdoor hot tub and pool. I was in the hot tub before dawn every morning. Good fitness facilities as well. I wanted to make sure I got a chance to see the town while I was there. The hotel has great running maps that take you through the historic district. I recommend a walk or run to see the architecture. It is also in good proximity to local attractions and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EMPLOYEE”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: With her bright smile and her warm welcoming hello, Kristen Brown goes above and beyond to make every stay a feeling of returning home. I hope you realize what a gem of a employee you have! David Brown

Reviews.Title: “Starbucks all around!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTrip53
Reviews.Content: If you like your Starbucks close, you couldn't ask for a better location. There are 5 within a 1/2 mile, Starbucks in your room and Starbucks in the lobby! The staff was wonderful and we received a complimentary upgrade with an amazing view of the city and Camelback Mountain. This is the perfect location for being in the center of everything; sporting events, restaurants and the ASU downtown campus. It's only a block from the light rail station and close to the highways if you need to go anywhere else. The room quality, service and restaurant were all fantastic. We have joined the frequent stay club as I know we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Summer time - Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Cededone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during recent weekend stay to catch DBacks game. Hotel is great location to all sporting venues. Staff is very helpful and rooms are excellent. 4th floor pool and workout/gym are great addition. Pool has bar service as well. Beat the heat by hanging out here till you decide what to do that evening. Hotel was near empty as who comes to Phoenix in the summertime with temps in the 100's besides my traveling party . I would highly recommend this hotel in every regard for business or pleasure any time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experiance and would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Was a great experince staying at this hotel. Would definitely stay here again. The staff was extremely friendly & helpful. Was very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “the best ever experience”
Reviews.Author: rexleo
Reviews.Content: I have to say this hotel sets the standards for all other sheratons. The feel of it is not HOTEL LIKE! The colors and materials are superb! The service levels in this hotel is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Chase Field and US Airways center”
Reviews.Author: PhilThePhotographer
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Phoenix downtown is a great location spot if you are visiting an event at the D'backs baseball field or US Airways center (Suns basketball) or convention center. Seems to be a good safe location - did not see many police nor did we ever feel unsafe or worried about being out after dark. This is irrelevant for some I suppose because I do carry a gun at all times so I never feel unsafe. The good news is that AZ is open carry and concealed carry friendly for those of legal age and not licensed to carry elsewhere just note that the venues mentioned above are off-limits for guns. Food choices are limited downtown but there are a few gems within walking distance if you don't mind the $$-$$$ price range restaurants. There is a Subway, Einstein bagles, Starbucks, and Hooters right there around the hotel. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant which looked decent but pricey. Access to freeway is convenient and a short hop in a car to neighboring areas (20min) gets you any kind of food style you want. Traffic does bunch up at rush hour though so plan ahead. The hotel itself was a nice typical Sheraton.. very accomodating friendly staff with good condition bldg. Underground self-parking was slightly pricey $17/night but cheaper than east coast or west coast places and convenient. The lot is open to public so it does fill up with non-hotel visitors and can force you to park a block and a half away in an overflow lot late at night. Rooms are modern with nice HD tv setup and bathroom facilities. We did have a slightly sagging bed in a dbl room which was reported. There is only ONE water fountain in the hotel and it's on pool deck. AZ was 113F while we were there and I was shocked that such a place didn't have water fountains... therefore. rely solely on bottled water. The pool was small but good for kids and family to cool off. WiFi is ridiculously overpriced $12/24hr period... this is wrong. WiFi should ALWAYS be free for registered guests. If you want free wifi the lobby has a signal at no cost to guests but who wants to sit in the lobby and do computer work that should be free in your room? Really Sheraton? Come on!! The other odd thing about the hotel is that there are 2 elevator routes and only goes to the parking garage - the other goes to the floors in the high teens and 20's. Inconvenient ridiculous design. Not a bad place but just little quirks and of course my pet peeve which is to charge guests for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Traci Nelson Best waitress”
Reviews.Author: bennyagwm
Reviews.Content: Traci is opne of the friendliest and professional waitresses I have had in a long time. I highly recommend her for comendation! Benny Ferguson

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay but one bad incident”
Reviews.Author: joespie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights to attend a convention from Aug. 1-6, 2011 overall we had great time except for the weather which averages 113 almost everyday and one bad incident Friday afternoon with one of the baggage handler when we asked for a shuttle services schedule. He responded rudely and I reported it to the management. One bad apple ruins the whole experience. Because of the incident we are not coming back to this hotel. We went to visit the Arizona Science Center and we enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive property, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: alphabetkid
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel to attend a conference. I had a north-facing room on the 11th floor. This is a stunning property: the lobby features truly fabulous artwork and many pleasant seating areas. My room was spacious and had furniture and lighting in abundance, without feeling crowded. (I really liked the armchair by the window.) I also appreciated the spacious feel of the bathroom: there was room enough to use the tub, sink, and toilet without bashing into anything else, which is not often the case in hotels. The fitness centre and pool were impressive, and I took advantage of both more than once. The fourth floor, where the fitness centre and pool are located, also features a deck area with native plants, where it's very pleasant to sit and enjoy the sun. Convenient location, right downtown and within walking distance of the light rail transit. Desk staff were excellent: very pleasant, and more than willing to go the extra mile to iron out an issue with payment on check-out. I'd definitely consider staying here again, should I ever return to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! I wish they could all be like this!”
Reviews.Author: druggist87
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, nicely decorated. The room felt like walking into home and not a hotel room. The half bath off the living area was a nice touch when traveling with a family. The beds were comfy and we had perfect control of the air conditioning. I liked the security of having to use the room key to access your floor in the elevator, that was a nice safety feature. The valet service gentlemen were helpful and friendly. The only thing that was not nice was $12.95 per day for Wi-Fi in the room, but everything else was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Shivas1Irons
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! There is a lot to like about this hotel, but the best part is the service by all members of the hotel team. Check-in (Jenny) was very accommodating despite a little glitch on a second room reservation (perhaps on my part), the well appointed room on the concierge level overlooked the new strikingly beautiful Phoenix Convention Center, our lunch of heirloom tomato soup and salmon wraps was excellent, front drive management was friendly and eager to assist, housekeeping was quiet and effective, and Tom at check-out recommended a Trip Advisor critique. The only downside about this trip was we didn't have any time to enjoy the family friendly pool facilities and spa. GM Leo Percopa has assembled a quality team who are there to please.

Reviews.Title: “great location downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: KMB33
Reviews.Content: this relatively new Sheraton is conveniently located a short walk from the Convention Center. But more than that, every interaction with staff was extremely pleasant, from the desk to the concierge to the valet outside handing me a bottle of water as I came in from my run.... free wifi in the lobby is a nice touch too. Small but sweet pool area, fantastic gym. The Club level lounge is second to none and even open for breakfast on the weekends unlike a lot of other chain hotels. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Wayne062
Reviews.Content: Kristen our Conseirge was just great. She was very helpful, providing lots of information on local sites and well as handling our car rental. She was pleasant and a pleasure to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jhumphreylkn
Reviews.Content: Very Comfortable, from the staff who welcome you like an old friend, to the well appointed, and cozy guest rooms, this is a great place to be at-home-away-from-home.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: rileytm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what we needed! My wife and I switched to the Sheraton after staying a few nights at another hotel that was mediocre at best. From the moment we walked into the Sheraton, we noticed how relaxing it was: the scent in the air was wonderful, the lobby was spacious, and the staff immediately greeted us with a friendly smile. Our room was available for early check-in, and we were given two complimentary bottles of water. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, the shower had good water pressure, and the room was very clean. Our favorite part of the hotel was the pool. It had a pool-side bar with a friendly attendant who delivered drinks to us while in the pool. Although we did not dine at the hotel, the food and drink options were very attractive. We only stayed three nights at this hotel, but it was enough time to designate this hotel as my only option when I visit Phoenix. Compared to the other similarly priced hotels in the downtown area, this hotel is by far superior and is worth paying a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “NY elks felt welcome in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: mjtigger25
Reviews.Content: Even though there were elks everywhere Tracy Simmons greeted us each morning with a wonderful smile and a cheerful good morning (and it was early!!) Everyone expressed their gratitude that we were here and it was truly felt.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner at The District”
Reviews.Author: CaveCreekAng
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the hotel, but had the most amazing experience at restaurant in the hotel, The District. From the moment we drove up, the Valet was most helpful and cheerful! Then, we were surprised to see that this was a host hotel for the baseball All Star Game because the lobby was bustling with people and merchandise for sale. This made us think it might compromise our experience because we were going for a family birthday dinner. In no way did the All Star Game activities affect our dinner. We were greeted with a warm welcoming smile from the hostess, had a very friendly, fast and helpful bartender at the bar, then after we were seated, we were blown away at the most incredible service we have had in a long time. Not to mention the food was to die for! For our party of five, we sampled quite a few different menu items and everything was amazing! They even grow fresh veggies and herbs on the roof! And, you can taste the difference with those freshly picked veggies in the garden salad I had. The filet was the best I ever remember having. Our server, Ian, was so patient with us and truly seemed like he loved his job. Being in the hospitality industry myself, I think I'm a bit more critical than most when it comes to service, but The District was such a wonderful experience, I felt I had to share. Keep doing whatever you are doing because it's working. We will be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: DebbyGC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Rooms are very nice, super comfy beds. Staff was very nice, especially Tracy Simmons in the restaurant. Tour guide/server rolled into one!! Breakfast buffet was amazing!!! I travel to PHX frequently, I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “As a flight attendant for 25 years, outside of Europe, this location is hands~down the best location in our system.”
Reviews.Author: keliadams
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, beautiful rooms, staff is SO accommodating and personal attention is given in a comfortable yet professional manner. From front desk to restaurant staff~ Especially Tracy Simmons in the restaurant...top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: cactuskev
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in June and it was ojne of the best hotel experiences I've had in a long time. From the moment of checkin to the wonderful room and excellent bar/restuarant - everything I hoped for was there. Really great location in downtown Phoenix, super clean and cool place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Quiet and Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: opie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in Downtown Phoenix for five nights at the end of June to attend a volleyball tournament at the convention center a few blocks away. This is the third year we've stayed and never been disappointed yet. Our choice has been for a suite at Club Level in order to enjoy breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres with a glass of wine for a modest price. The rooms are quiet, the beds are great, and the staff responds if there is an issue. We will stay there again for events at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Volleyball Festival 2011 Trip”
Reviews.Author: cpostiff
Reviews.Content: After a long week of volleyball it was nice of Chris A. to give us excellent service and provide us with help loading our car for our departure. Even though there were a lot of guests Chris A. never made us feel like he was too busy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MMRDalton_Georgia
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conventionat the Phoenix convention center. Awesome location. Also short walk to the Diamondbacks stadium. Great restaurants within a short walk. Rooms were very clean, updated and convenient. Town car to airport was an added plus! Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT staff, excellent property for meetings and classy decor”
Reviews.Author: Ringerjo
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton sets a new standard for Sheraton hotels. The staff definitely focus on you, the guest. The rooms are all updated and the lobby is very bright and inviting. We had a meeting here and the staff's number one objective was to please the meeting guests - and it showed. My next visit to Downtown Phoenix, whether business or pleasure, will be the Sheraton Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Check in”
Reviews.Author: MrFeatherFastback
Reviews.Content: Valet and bellman were excellent !! Front desk needs refinement and training.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda_Henson_Sorrow
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for using the convention center. Amazing Beds, nice views, good food, free water in the room. Dredful Hot Pool on stark deck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ComputerMaverick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently enjoyed four nights and five days in Phoenix and stayed at the Sheraton Downtown. We highly recommend the hotel for travelers into the Phoenix downtown area. The hotel is close walking distance to the convention center, baseball park, and other major venues. There is an AMC movie theater across the street from the hotel. The staff was most attentive to any and all of our needs and were outstanding. We were extremely pleased with the friendly support staff of the hotel. Our room was excellent. It was cleaned to perfection each day and the climate control was great. With the outside temp in the 100+, it was refreshing to enter the room with a cool room. The bed and bedding was great and comfortable. LCD TV and cable selection was very good. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: dkd_11
Reviews.Content: Just spent several days at Sheraton Downtown Phoenix. Not only was the hotel absolutely gorgeous, but the employees were amazing. Every person at the front desk went out of their way to help, greet, and accommodate. Amelia DeOuerez (?) cleaned our room each day to a perfect shine. The concierge's recommendations were perfect. The breakfast buffet was scrumptious. I'd stay here again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: AFolkerth
Reviews.Content: I had to do a quick business trip to Phoenix so I did not spend a great deal of time in the hotel, but when I was there, it was great all the way around. I did get a chance to use the fitness room which was excellent; I dined in the restaurant which had great food and great service; and I enjoyed my short time in the room with a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Copreese
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in mid May. The staff was wonderful. The weather was perfect. The room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Best restaurant service in downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: lauraconrad
Reviews.Content: I want to recognize Ashley Mendez, wait staff at the District Restaurant, located in the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown. I was walking around downtown and stopped in on a whim. I had a lovely lunch outside and she could not have been nicer, friendlier or more attentive. My market salad with salmon (her recommendation) was wonderful, the martini chilled to perfection, but Ashley is what will make me come back and bring friends!

Reviews.Title: “Lauren Witte is the reason I come back to the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: DavidLuper
Reviews.Content: Actually the entire staff at the District are all fabulous. I have been coming to Phoenix weekly for the last 8 months, and I stay at the Sheraton primarily because of how warm, personable, and welcoming the staff are. Lauren in particular has been wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: brothers7
Reviews.Content: We went to Phoenix to attend a wedding and stayed at the Sheraton Phoenix downtown. The hotel was great. Location was perfect for us. Associate Amanda Copeland was extremely personable and patient. I would highly recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “The best in Phoenix--Outstanding in everything!!”
Reviews.Author: Gigum
Reviews.Content: I always check TripAdvisor before booking a hotel. The Sheraton Downtown was rated #2 but after my recent stay, I dont understand why they are not # 1!! Super clean, outstanding service, beautiful facilities and a great location, when in Phoenix, the Sheraton Downtown is a place to stay. I stayed on the Club level and used the Club Lounge every day. The view of the Phoenix area was awesome! the Lounge is blessed to have two of their outstanding employees, Maribell and Mafy available to make our stay very special. What a pleasure to stay here. Thanks to all of the Hotel staff. My wife an I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Everything and everyone at the Sheraton Phoenix were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: workWyoming
Reviews.Content: We had many meals at the hotel restaurant. We wanted to commend Tracy Nelson on the excellent service. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “High End Service - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveSunshineCA
Reviews.Content: From the doormen, bell, check-in staff, concierge to housekeeping: This hotel trains it's staff WELL. I've stayed in alot of hotels, and usually there is someone at a large hotel that is just bored as heck with there job, but not here. Hands down great place, rooms, buffet , gym, pools, lobby, computer center: all around a great hotel with 5 star service!

Reviews.Title: “Quality staff and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ron60878
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Phoenix Downtown for the first time, 5-11 to 5-15-2011. Outstanding experience. Ryan E. and Robin are both great representatives of the quality of the staff. Service was outstanding, prompt and pleasant. The facilities and accommodations were wonderfully maintained. Ron & Susie Rowe

Reviews.Title: “A Satisfied Customer Service Snob”
Reviews.Author: dnldwarren
Reviews.Content: I work in the airline industry, with people from all walks of life, on a daily basis. Therefore, I expect to receive exactly the type of service I give to my guests-and that's exactly what I received here at this Hotel. From checkin to checkout i was fully accomodated. The front desk staff looked excellent and were highly professional. The hotel room was picture-perfect, literally. As soon as i sank into the bed, I fell asleep...that's unusual for my lifestyle lol...The breakfast was amazing and scrumptious...loved the buffet and the price, but what really made my day was the hostess, Cammie & my server Julynn, There smiles and conversational manner really made me feel welcomed....they exceeded my expectations this morning in the best way. I travel on a pretty consistent basis. I must say that it is not often that I come across this high standard of service. This is why The Sheraton Downtown is the talk of the town!

Reviews.Title: “This is what a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: HappyJPTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely 4 day stay for a conference in May 2011. The hotel is a nice balance of tasteful architecture and decor along with very practical and well functioning staff, conference space, etc. One of the highlights for me was the fitness area and pool The fitness center is well designed, with up to date equipment. The pool is really delightful. It is well over 25 yards long, and a great way to work out in the early morning, before families or sunbathers come for later in the day. The whirlpool is also nice. My only one small request would be to have a big clock in the pool and whirlpool area. I kept having to get out to look at my watch. It would also be nice to see the pool dimensions written somewhere. The staff at the front desk were very helpful, calm and friendly. I shared a room with a colleague from another city, and they were able to divide the reservation into a "shared"reservation so both of us could get Starwood points for the room. I had lent my flashdrive to someone who lost it. The hotel staff were quite gracious in helping me look for it and took personal interest in the matter. I was busy with the conference the whole time, but went across the street for a lovely lunch at a Greek restaurant, and then a delicious dinner at another restaurant in the same complex (I believe the name was 1130). The hotel restaurant and lobby bar was also very nice- excellent service and reasonable fare. The conference food was also very good for the breakfasta and lunches. There were also some cute souvenir stores across the street to buy gifts for the kids to bring home. I would definitely recommend this for another business trip and conference.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: vahnaz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for Mother's Day. It was such a delight to find this gem in downtown Phoenix. The attention paid to every minute detail and the courtesy shown by the entire staff, made this a memorable and most pleasurable experience for me and my family. l must say, their Mother's Day Brunch was just as pleasureable to look at, as it was delicous, from filet mingnon to all of the delectable desserts. They even had a cute station where the little one's could make the very own personlized cards to present to their moms. And most of all...It all wasn't a budget buster. All in all, just a beautiful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, outstanding hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Laterisers
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights in a end of the hall room, very quiet and clean. Each of the staff I spoke with were friendly and eager to assist. Did not eat at the property restaurants because there were so many great places to eat close right accross the street (Sams Cafe, Big Fat Greek, etc...) and i wanted to walk and enjoy the weather, I did hear very good things from others at the conference about the onsite restaurants. Bed was great as I had read on reviews posted here. Great location and appeared to be very safe, easy walking distance to see the Diamondbacks or Suns, saw police patrolling not only those areas but most of the areas in Phoenix I visited and felt very safe walking to local restaurants. Only three negative comment's first is smokers would gather outside the front door at lunch, other times of the day most used the break area by the parking garage.Next if you are wanting to visit shopping malls, you will need to rent a car or use a cab. Biggest complaint, no free wi-fi in the rooms, at a place as nice and service oriented as this one, paying for internet in your room is a crime! Overall one of the best hotels for attending a conference I have been to. I am looking forward to returning with my family to see more of Phoenix and staying again at the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Conference in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: Angelescitypi
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a totally great experience from check in to check out. They offered a room which was very comfortable, beautifully climate controlled with great toiletries. The breakfast buffet was ample the location was ideal and I felt safe and protected throughout my week long stay. They provided musical entertainment in their lounges at night. There really is nothing bad I can say about my August experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel -- the best of Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: WahineOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: I stay in Sheratons & Westins as often as possible, and this particular Sheraton is the best I've ever stayed in. The hotel is three years old and looks brand new. They have both valet & on-site self-parking, and the self-parking is very easy to access, with an elevator to the lobby that also can take you to the first 17 floors of the hotel. If you can get an upgrade to the club floor, or have high enough status with SPG to get club access, it's well worth it. Continental breakfast in the club lounge is excellent, with a variety of menu items including a range of cold cereals, hard-boiled eggs, beautiful fresh fruit (both whole and cut-up), and Starbucks coffee, all complimentary. Unlike most hotel club lounges, this one is open from 6AM - 11AM 7 days a week (normally at Sheratons & Westins the club lounges are open only until 9 or 9:30 AM weekedays and closed on weekends). In the afternoon there is an excellent light finger-food buffet provided from 4PM - 7PM, also 7 days/week. The staff here is exceptionally friendly & helpful. The on-site restaurant has excellent (but over-priced) food. And the hotel also offers 24 hour room service. Fitness center is state of the art. I simply can't think of anything bad to say about this hotel -- it will be my preferred hotel any time I'm in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: OldLawnGnome
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel attending a 400+ person conference. The staff was excellent. They called me by name (gee the convention nametag helped) and did a far better job of making me feel like an important guest, rather than someone who slept there for a night. Special cudos to Jenny at the Front Desk and Martin at the Bell Station.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service from Jason T. in the District Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: wclerizier
