Reviews.Content: Jason T. has exceeded my expectations and I am pleased with the exceptional service he provided me. He is an excellent employee who always does his job with a smile and ready to assist. Jason is true professional.

Reviews.Title: “Dinner in the restaurant Sheraton Phoenix downtown was superb.”
Reviews.Author: margthetreasurer
Reviews.Content: - wine list and menu were carefully explained so that the item ordered could be appreciated -service to our group of 14 was excellent -staff excelled in their jobs and were passionate about their product

Reviews.Title: “Amy Clapp did an awesome job of waiting on our group”
Reviews.Author: khuff40
Reviews.Content: First off this Sheraton is very nice, the work out room is one of the best i have ever used in a hotel. Second I wanted to give Amy Clapp some recognition as she was just a very nice person, did a great job of taking care of our group while we were in the hotel lobby lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable room, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: TxGardenGirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Downtown Phoenix for a business conference. The hotel is fairly close to the airport, although there is no free shuttle from airport to hotel. The cab ride was $25, or the hotel's shuttle is $12 one way. The hotel staff were all very friendly and courteous and efficient. My room was fairly spacious, with a king size bed, coffee maker, mini fridge, flat screen TV, and large desk area. The room was exceptionally clean, and looked to have been redecorated recently. Furniture was on the modern side, with clean lines. The bathroom had a granite countertop and was larger than average. And the bed -- SOOO comfortable, with good mattress, nice quality linens, and fantastic pillows. Room service was prompt, with tasty food that was not outrageously expensive. Really only noticed two negatives during my stay: (1) I had to pay $12.95 a day for internet, and (2) the towels were rough and thin. The hotel bar was quite nice - again, a modern flair to it, with a good selection of house specialty "muddled" drinks. All in all, a very nice and well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and staff in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: jarocha914
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a business trip and had a great stay at this hotel. This place must be brand new - everything is open, ariy and elegant. I arrived at the same time as a large group so additional staff came forward to check us in promptly. Due to my SPG status, I was put on the Club Level which has spectacular views of the city. The Club Lounge is the nicest I've been in at any Sheraton: flat screens, nice sofas, beverages, snacks and attentative staff (Mirabelle). I met my cousins at the restaurant, District Kitchen, and had a great dinner of calamari and salmon. It's a swanky place with a trendy bar - not your run of the mill hotel salad, sandwich and burger place. Later that night I had to print slides for a customer meeting and the front desk directed me to the on-site Kinko's Fedex which has full size copier / printers. This was a big step up from the small desktop devices found in other hotel business centers. Overall this is a GREAT hotel and I plan to stay here the next time I have business or vacation in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Standard Sheraton, Nice Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: PAMichelle
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference. I am one who does appreciate the green initiative. Traveling solo, I had more than enough towels and toiletries to last me the final 4 days I was there (I did receive housekeeping the first day as I forgot to hang the sign on my door). The staff were extremely friendly from the front desk to housekeeping to the bellhops...absolutely everyone I encountered. I liked the Link right next to Starbucks in the lobby where I could get a coffee, check email, and print my boarding passes. The location is good with plenty of dining options across the street at the Arizona Center. The District Restaurant was excellent and I will be writing a separate review on that. I would definitely return given the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “It is a Sheraton...with lots of quirkiness!”
Reviews.Author: Christmas2010
Reviews.Content: So many odd things happened during our stay that it is hard to explain. The front desk staff is nice enough, and they have the 'smile and nod' response down pat, but only when pressed do rooms appear that somehow were a minute ago booked!! On the other hand, the front desk manager didn't hesitate a moment to give me his direct cell phone number so I could contact him with any further problems. Unfortunately, I had to call him at least twice more during my 4 day stay. One evening the meal in the District restaurant was fantastic! Really really good. The next time we dined there, the service was non-existent and the restaurant manager was defensive and had a terrible attitude. The gym is fabulous! One of the best around, but there is no spa at all and the pool, even though advertised as heated, is cold and small (although the hot tub is nice). The view from my room was amazing and the bed and bedding were great, but I think that housekeeping is the real weak link in this hotel. When I first entered my room there was a used towel and robe hanging on the back of the bathroom door! Disgusting. It took several calls to get extra hangers and they were very stingey with their toiletries. The bathroom was great, very spacious, and the complementary bottled water was a nice touch. But paying for wifi is an insult, particularly since you can use computers in their 'connect lounge' for free and the wifi in the Club Lounge on the 28th floor is free. A hotel should be ashamed of itself to nickel and dime a traveler like that, especially when they look you in the eye and tell you how much they care about your comfort. The location was very convenient for us next to the convention center. The hotel does not have a complementary airport shuttle, which is outrageous since the airport is only about 3 miles away. The private van costs $12 one way and leaves the hotel every half hour. Overall, the service was sub-par, the gym was great and the lack of value was hard to take.

Reviews.Title: “Well run but a few small details are bothersome.”
Reviews.Author: jordanvt
Reviews.Content: My small Sheraton rant : $13/day for wifi? When the Red Roof Inn beats you on included features it's a sign. Come on guys, it's even free at McDonalds. Charging for it is as lame as the $4 bottles of Nestle brand tap water that I've hidden from my 4 year old. Yes, that's another Sheraton "feature". This is matched by another oddly greenwash offering. They have the "Make a Green Choice" card which allows you to completely skip housekeeping service for you room if you hang the card from your door handle. They give you a $5 in house gift card (valid only at this hotel) that you can use as a credit towards drinks or food. Now this is a GREAT deal for the hotel, since they no longer need to pay the labor charge for having a maid come in and make up the room, no towels to wash, no sheets to change, no coffee and tea to restock. Yes, this is indeed the green choice, as in abundant green savings for Sheraton. Other notes: Parking is $17/day or $25/day for valet. Don't get me wrong the hotel is run very well, surely one of the best in Phoenix. Staff is great, facility is well maintained. These extra charges are unexpectedly nickle and dime annoying. If it weren't for the conference, we'd probably have chosen something less downtown and with more features. If elegant and upscale is your thing, sure. If value is more important, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect customer service”
Reviews.Author: talk2michelle
Reviews.Content: For the price of the room, I expected more. The check in process was painfully slow. The lobby was pretty and I loved the gift shop and even the restaurant until I got food poisoning. It was awful. I had to pay a few hundred more dollars to get an extra night to recover, missed most of my conference, and had to pay to change my plane ticket. The hotel staff was completely incompetent and although I called, explained, and paid for the next night, my sleep was interupted with 3 more attempts to remind me to leave, to try to clean the room although I asked them not to, and to call and see why I was still there. When I asked room service to bring me anything I could eat while ill - rice, broth, etc they came up with nothing. I'll never go back,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AmberBock
Reviews.Content: Our stay began with a smooth, efficient check in (thanks Jess!). Our 17th floor foom was large, clean and had a great view of the city. A mini refrig was an unexpected bonus. Stopped at the gym before dinner. Hands down the best hotel gym I have seen and I have seen many. Next it was drinks and dinner at the District Restaurant bar (the District is the main dining room at the hotel). Happy hour values were amazing and happy hour runs through 7 and starts again at 10. Amazing selection of draft microbeers and very good wines by the glass. Dinner was a rib eye and side of mac and cheese. Absolutely great food. Bar service from the bartenders was fast and friendly. I did not catch their names but for mgmt it was the thursday night arizona beat duke. Mgmt and staff at this hotel are really xoing the job. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Starwood property I stayed at this week-& I stayed at 3!”
Reviews.Author: BobLovesSRS
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Starwood hotels Scott and I have ever stayed at. It was easy to find. Our check-in was smoothe. The Front Office Manager (I believe his name is Duncan) checked us in, and was personable, efficient, and informative. He told us the food in the restaurant was great. I would much rather venture out, and eat at a local independent owned restaurant. Scott and I decided to have a drink in the lounge, where we met server, Paige Kumm. She was personable, and quite the sales person. She talked Scott into trying something on the drink menu, and he loved it! After experiencing Paige's Outstanding service, we decided to take the advice of the FOM, and dine in the lounge with Paige. (I never guessed I would be dining in a lounge!-I'm not saying I haven't before. It just wasn't my intent the particular evening we stayed.) We left Paige for a short bit, spent some time in the comfortable, relaxing, oudoor whirlpool, and returned to the lounge later to dine. Scott loved his scallops which are on the daily menu, and I enjoyed the evening dinner special. Even though I enjoyed my meal, I'll most likely go with the scallops when I return. Oh yes, and kudos should go to the person who cleaned our room. We were in room 1045 3/20, and the spacious, attractive room was extremely clean. I've probably stayed at 200 hotels in my life, and this was one of the cleanest! OK, I know this review was long, but I had to rave!!

Reviews.Title: “The bar staff is exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: cpinnell
Reviews.Content: Jerry at the bar always took care of me. He's one of the best bartenders I have experienced in my travels. Cheers to you, Jerry!

Reviews.Title: “Jerry Van Dusen goes out of his way to serve you at the lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: Jughead1952
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in the hotel and had a very good experience. One afternoon when my wife and I wanted a soda to take up to the room, he went and found larger plastic cups for us. Also when I did not have the discount coupon that was in my room, he said just to come by later that evening whenever it was convenient with the coupon and he would ring up the bill then. Great attitude and service. Best pancakes I have had in a long time for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SBH14
Reviews.Content: The hotel and amenities were fabulous---nice, clean, spacious rooms. The "Go Green" option is a thoughtful addition to services. The restaurant located within the hotel, The District, has an exceptional waiter in Adryan! I witnessed a very driven young man who would do well to be further educated in the hotel business world. My "almost" part to my review is the fact that if you stay at the hotel you are charged an excessive amount of $17/day to park in the attached parking lot. While I loved the hotel, I honestly do not plan to stay there again---despite the location to the Convention Center and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sdevereaux
Reviews.Content: The staff are very, very attentive. Conference food was excellent. Our housekeeper was wonderful. Our favorite staff member was Lauren, a cocktail server in the lobby and hotel bar. She remembered us and took great care of us.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller-Bajan
Reviews.Content: Given the reviews and the room cost of this hotel, I had high expectations. The highlights of this hotel are (1) It is close to the convention centre just a block walking distance (2) There is a small shopping centre across the road with restaurants, a mini-mart and Starbucks Coffee (3) the room is large and clean. (4) The staff is efficient. However this hotel needs some upkeep, the toilet and tub in the bathroom were chipped. Also, beware of the staff outside calling a cab/car for you. Twice they recommended a service which was more expensive that a regular taxi. All is all, it was an ok experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: mommaK219
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Phoenix every December. This is the 2nd time we have stayed at the Sheraton, and I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel! The staff will go out of their way to please you. The friendliness and helpfullness of the staff is wonderful, you feel like you are staying with friends! The rooms are clean, and the beds are very comfortable. There was a big party of us going to an event, and we needed numerous taxi's. One of the staff members told us he knew someone who could get us to our event in 2 SUV's, at a good price, and that is exactly what happened. I cannot say enough about this Hotel and the staff! I encourage anyone going to Phoenix to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: DavidLuper
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown are welcoming, warm, and highly professional - I always feel taken care of when I am there. In particular, Belen Boll, Cynthia Carlareillo, and the fantastic evening serving crew - Lauren, Sam, and Mony - make it truly enjoyable to stay at the Sheraton. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: TraciCavendish
Reviews.Content: Michelle P did a FANTASTIC job serving our very LARGE group of dancers and their mothers in a short period of time. And all on separate checks. It was no small task and she did a great job! We were very appreciative.

Reviews.Title: “Simply one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia8943
Reviews.Content: From the very moment our cab door was opened by a valet through every single staff interaction throughout the week, it was a complete pleasure. Their attentiveness, pleasant attitude and willingness to be of service were consistantly great. Loved, loved, loved the wireless lounge in the lobby. It made the little bit of extra work and email checking I had to do each day so easy & enjoyable. The entire hotel was always spotless and I felt very safe and comfortable wherever I went. Thanks so much for a terrific week!

Reviews.Title: “Looks good, feels bad!”
Reviews.Author: JeannieChiliBeanie
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient to convention and arts center. Rooms are tiny, halls are dark and low ceilinged -- felt like I was back in the 70's once I left the lobby. Two different days, the room was not serviced by housekeeping -- which is no big deal except that we really did run out of towels (even after re-using them) and we also had to call for toilet paper because when the room was attended to, housekeeping did not notice that. These are small things, but when you are traveling for a busy convention they eat up minutes and also create a sort of hassled feeling. One day I returned from a busy day of meetings and the room still had not been freshened up by 4 p.m. I called guest services and asked that they at least come up and take out the trash/exchange the towels before we returned at 9 p.m. It was still not tended to, so as we were preparing to sleep, we had to stay up and wait for housekeeping to do what they should have done at 9 in the morning or at 4 p.m. when I asked. The poor evening housekeeping staff looked at us like we were a nuisance, but it wasn't their fault-- or ours -- it was the previous shift's. Note that at this hotel you only have the option to call "guest services" for everything -- no separate lines for the front desk or housekeeping. There was not one time that I called guest services and got directly to a person. You have to listen to a recording and then be put on hold when you call for help. Next, the internet access in this property is arcane and byzantine. Aside from the fact that it costs $13.00/day, it is hard to access. The front desk had blocked ours (because we were listed under more than one name, but it was all on my credit card which they had on file downstairs) and after repeated requests to get access it was repeatedly impossible to log onto the internet. This problem persisted over multiple days and shifts even though the front desk said they would fix it. This headache forced me to go across the street to work and catch up on correspondence at Starbuck's. I am flexible and experienced at travel and willing to put up with a hurdle or two, but this was just dumb. After the first or second ask someone should have just made sure I got what I needed. I did call the 800 number on the card on the desk and the line was always busy. I have to say I NEVER have this problem at Marriotts -- even the downscale properties like Fairfield Inn. There is a sort of internet cafe in the lobby with the offer of printing boarding passes free. It does work, but 9 out of 10 people get pretty confused about how to make it work -- and I am talking about sophisticated business travelers who find this property's particular log in to check in screens confusing. There is no reason for it to be confusing or for grown men and women to have to stumble around asking each other for help. I saw numbers of people decide to just leave and get their passes at the airport after being frustrated. I went to the concierge at one point to inquire about transportation for a special event. She was on the phone on what was clearly a personal call ...giggling, making small talk with a friend or lover, while several of us stood and waited and the line grew longer. And though this is an expensive convention hotel in a major downtown area, we were harrasssed by a homeless creep right in front of the property. The man followed us into the building and would've gotten into the elevator with us had we not retreated and asked the front desk to call security. Security was there in a jiffy and the fistfight did not last long. I know that this creeper was not the hotel's problem, but on the other hand I have never had to witness anything like this in any other fine hotel. Just a heads up to anyone coming down here for a convention, just because you are paying top dollar for this Sheraton doesn't mean you will be safer or more secure. Three blocks up the street on Van Buren is a Springfield Suites hotel. It costs half as much, is probably just as safe and the rooms are bigger, the beds are bigger. Breakfast is free there, the internet is free there and it works and the pool is outdoors and about the same size as this one. For your money you will get a better night's sleep there, not have to wait as long at the elevator, not have to beg to get your room made up and only walk about a block further to get to the convention center. We ate a $17 breakfast here that was not very good. It should at least be good in a property like this. No kidding, the waffles are just as good at that free buffet up the street at the SpringHill. It has been a long time since I have felt this "had" by a chain property. More than one guest services/desk/housekeeping person had a chance to make the impression different, but instead I was made to feel like a nuisance. (Except for one employee at the front desk named Jess -- she was professional, positive and tried immediately to make things better)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: phoenixphada11
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was a wonderful experience. I found the location was excellent for dining and culture. The sporting arena and ball park are within walking distance as well as the short rail. I found the staff including housekeeping were excellent(Amelia Dequeiroz) nice. On my next visit to Phoenix, I will stay at the Sheraton Phoenix downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and Staff the Best”
Reviews.Author: collin2007
Reviews.Content: The best hotel, clean, staff super, maid services excellent, location great. I will come back again. Irene

Reviews.Title: “Close to US Airways Centre and Looks Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: ajsm
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the hotel looks older, but inside it must have been recently renovated. We were upgraded to the club floor which has a small lounge offering some snacks and non-alcoholic drinks (you can also buy alcohol) and most importantly free and speedy internet which saves around $15 per day. The lounge is is on the 28th floor and the rooms nearest the lounge are numbered 2828, 2827, 2826... we were further down the hall in 2810 but still managed to receive the free internet signal. The hotel has valet parking but the self-parking is under the hotel, so it's convenient and cheaper to park the car yourself. Only about a ten minute walk from US Airways Centre if you're there to watch the Suns play.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: JamesAOwens
Reviews.Content: When I heard that our annual conference was in Arizona, I was hoping for Scottsdale and was a little grumpy when I heard, “downtown Phoenix!” The first night upon arriving I went to the District American Kitchen restaurant for a quick meal. That evening they featured a hanger steak entrée. I asked to have a Caesar salad with just the hanger steak (no sides) and they were quick to accommodate. The food and service were both excellent. It's important to note that as a frequent traveler and the owner of a wine and gourmet food shop that I rarely eat in hotel restaurants. However, we ate here for three other meals because of the quality of the food and the service. In addition to quality food and service, they have a wonderful selection of regional draft microbrews and a great wine selection. I did venture out to two other restaurants while there, but frankly wished that I had not done so and they were inferior. Belen Boll, assistant manager, was phenomenal, extremely knowledgeable and engaging! All of the wait staff was very attentive especially Narah Bradley who Belen asked to wait on us for our final function with clients. Also, when they bring the check for evening meals they bring an order of cotton candy with the bill. It’s a great touch! I have been raving about this hotel and restaurant since the trip and am looking forward to my next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: jdblk007
Reviews.Content: We were actually visiting a relative that was staying here for business. It had been a long time since I had eaten in down town Phoenix and we were looking for a place to eat. Kristin Brown was working the Concierge desk and we asked for her help. She took the time to ask what we were interested in and she also gave us some additional suggestions that she liked. We ended up at Sam's Cafe and had a wonderful experience. The little things are what make people stay and recommend a place to stay. I will be recommending Sheraton in the future. Go Devils!

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Assad was the warmest staff we encountered.”
Reviews.Author: arilkcup
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Phoenix well after 9pm and after checking in went in search of some libations. Mr. Austin Assad was helpful, kind and responsive, even though the kitchen was preparing to close within minutes. Would recommend his company to anyone in the Starwoods enterprise. We hit about 7Starwood hotels in 10 days and he was the warmest and most responsive staff we encountered. Thank you Austin.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: joann1979
Reviews.Content: hotel and bar staff are awesome matt tobey makes you feel like you known him all you life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Super Staff, Truly A Flagship Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: laxtodbx
Reviews.Content: I do not normally take the time to write reviews, However this property is worth the time. From check-in to cleanliness and a great new look this Sheraton won me over. I am switching my Platnium staus from Marriott to Starwood based on the last few stays at Starwood hotels this year. The food was also great including really great and friendly staff in the restaurants. I would like to single out the young man who took great care of me at breakfast, his name is Tracy Simmons. I dont know what or how they are doing it with there staff in this hotel but any company looking to improve customer service should stay here and see how it is done! ie... Delta oops did i just say that... YEP!

Reviews.Title: “Friday night food was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CPaulsen
Reviews.Content: We're coming back soon. The food is amazing. The wine was stellar. Thank you for the great service Bellan!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at a nicely appointed (and green!) hotel”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights in December. I was upgraded to a wonderful suite on the top floor. The gym was large, clean, and well maintained. The restaurant was great with great service, name recognition of hotel guests dining there, and wonderful service. The valet was one of the more efficient and friendly operations I've seen lately of big-box city hotels. Room service was prompt and very courteous. Definitely a perfect example of the "new" Sheraton that is definitely worth "rediscovering". My only gripe with the hotel is just it's website, which promises "Bose iPod Docking Station " in suites. What is actually there is a Bose radio (not a dock), so bring a cable if you want to play your own music through the Bose system. I didn't and I was bummed! That was literally the only negative, though.

Reviews.Title: “The service was great very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bfndr
Reviews.Content: Was really impressed with the staff and the quick service. The valet, and bellhop guys done an outstanding job at all hours, Definitly would recommend Scott Brennan. Room service was prompt but not very good with directions. I ordered there burger off the late night menu, and i specified my burger to be medium well and it was not. It was rare and it tasted like raw beef other than that the stay has been great, the views were great and material that the hotel was built out of was quaility. except for the artafficial wood work in the lobby,

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GMoney007
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Downtown Phoenix. Centrally located. I was there for a conference for 4 days. I was looking for a place to eat at 2 a.m. Jayme at the front desk was very courteous and helpful with me finding a place. Overall, the staff was wonderful from the bell men, to the front desk to housekeeping. I would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: sreikofski
Reviews.Content: I travel several times a year, and often stay in Sheraton hotels and resorts. This particular time stands out, though. Everything from the friendliness and service of the staff, comfort and cleanliness of the room, conference facilities all exceeded previous experiences and expectations. Julia Ochoa, my room keeper went above and beyond in caring for my room. Colleagues at this conference often commented on the superlative work the staff did in helping facilitate the conference, tend to guest needs, and making this a tremendous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: fraternityhq
Reviews.Content: On Thursday, December 2, 2010, I met a colleague for dinner in the hotel restuarant called District. We were blown away by the service from Narah Bradley. Not only did she help us understand our options, but you could tell that she really enjoyed her job and really treated us like her own customers. It was so refreshing. I would go back again and again just to be waited on her. Thank you for making our meal so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,super cmfortable rooms,attentive staff,excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ace98
Reviews.Content: Food and relaxed atmosphere in restaurant are well above average. Very attentive waiter Tracy Summers , made experience special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice upscale hotel in downtown Pheonix”
Reviews.Author: Billionaire53
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast buffet and the staff there are always nice and attentive. Tori my server, was relaxed and personable. The rooms are very nice, descent workout center, beaufiful lobby with computer access for free there. I walked right across the street to Brick's for a great flatbread pizza. This hotel is obviously business or convention oriented. Starbuck's in the lobby too with free USA Today. I have been here a few times and always look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding comfort in all areas of services”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldCityHotDaddy
Reviews.Content: From food services to all overnight facilaties, this hotel is one I want to return to most frequently. As a traveling airline employee, this Sheraton is tops of all hotels that I visit. Employees like Tori within the food services department exemplify the wonderful professional attitude that complements this crown jewel within the city of Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel. Incredibly nice and attentive employees”
Reviews.Author: mbstang99
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience I've had in years. Jason in the restaurant was the best. I work for and airline and he treated us as if we were "real people". That doesn't always happen. All of the staff are incredibly nice and I can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly present and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WendyKramer
Reviews.Content: Every single person at this hotel was extraordinary. I was at the gym when my husband called to tell me my mother had a heart attack back home. Not able to get me on my cell phone the security staff was super helpful to him tryingto find me. Because of the calls and arrangements I had to make, I was two hours late for breakfast -- not a good thing when you have insulin issues. In a very busy dining room I had to wait a bit. I asked the young blond hostess to get me some OJ which she immediately got. I told my server I was in insulin crash and to pay attention because I could only speak once. This has happened to me before and usually the servers either are stupid or freak out. Not at the Sheraton! You would think they had special training in this issue. My server brought the food exactly as I requested in minutes. From Chris the uber-friendly doorman to reception to the restuarant this may be the best service I have ever had in a convention hotel. The rooms are nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller R
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! Very clean and modern, certainly not the cookiecutter Sheraton I was expecting. Warm and prompt service, even in the midst of a big convention. Great location - near shops, restaurants, and the light rail system.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: soixante1997
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, I was welcomed by the friendly, attentive staff ... every encounter I had was an extremely positive one, from the valet staff, to the check-in team, to the room service personnel ... I travel every week, across the country, and am really impressed by the level of service here.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel where they nickel and dime you for everything”
Reviews.Author: DallasPeggy
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful and the front desk staff was helpful. Unfortunately, the room was clean but by no means spectacular. Especially given the exorbitant room rate. The bathroom was very standard, the towels and linens rough, and overall the room was small. I was there for a convention, and therefore had a small package shipped to the hotel. Upon checking out, I realized they had charged me $5 + tax for holding the package while I was at the convention during the day. Upon asking for a taxi, we were directed to a sedan which charged us double the taxi rate. I don't think it is unreasonable to expect some amenities when paying over $250 per night for a room. With these rates, I don't understand why they feel the need to charge for every small thing.

Reviews.Title: “brillant hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherry34
Reviews.Content: My husband have just returned from phoenix .We stayed in the Sheraton we found the staff polite pleasant and very helpful A VERY SPECIAL WORD OF THANKS TO KAITLIN ON THE concierge desk AND TO NADIA IN HOUSEKEEPING both girls made our stay special This was an ideal location for the Conference centre many thanks m

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Comfort, great service”
Reviews.Author: Derepente
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay and greatly appreciate the service from the bartenders, the reception staff and the room staff: especially Julia Ochoa. I appreciate all the extras for my coffee! I actually looked forward to sleeping each night the week I was there. It's true, the internet convenience could have been better. I can't really use the internet for business in the lobby so I did plan ahead and brought my own air card. The Gym has weights and the treadmills face toward the lap pool which was pretty long. Nice way to enjoy the later mornings before going back to meetings. At 179 govt rate, I was really happy. If I were to pay the full 220, I'd definitely recommend they throw in the internet wireless in the rooms or something like that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ditkadabears85
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. The hotel is new and facilities (exercise facility etc..) are great. The housekeeping staff (Amelia and others) were incredibly friendly, helpful and keep the rooms spotless. Best hotel in Phoenix for business. My only complaint is that internet should be included in the price of the room---otherwise my highest recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Sister Weekend”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAZ
Reviews.Content: My sister was in town visiting from Portland, Oregon and I decided to make it a special weekend by staying downtown as we were going to the Elton John concert Saturday night. I had heard great things about the Sheraton however this was my first experience staying at the hotel. The property is inviting from the moment you drive up. The valets are most efficient and friendly as well as the lobby staff and bellmen. The lobby is beautiful and very relaxing should you need to rest, use your computer or enjoy a beverage. There appeared to be several persons staying at the hotel for a convention however you never had a feeling that the hotel was crowed and service was always great. The rooms are tastefully decorated and our room on the 31st floor offered spectacular views of the valley. The beds are wonderful! Room service was pleasant and efficient as was our experience with all of the staff at the hotel. After the concert we enjoyed a nightcap at the lounge downstairs where they had live entertainment and again great service from the bar staff. I would highly recommend the Sheraton for anyone staying in the downtown area for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: kareny13
Reviews.Content: Well appointed: front desk check in, parking.. all staff very friendly and helpful. two banks of elevators which wll mean invariably you get into the wrong one. The Club Lounge is very well serviced: Starbucks coffee, bottled water and whoel fruit at all times. Breakfast included baked good, hard boiled eggs, cut fruit, yogurt, cereal and granola mix. Afternoon had soft drinks; cut vegetables, cheese & crackers as well as 2 hot items. Rooms are slightly dated, coudl do with an update and wish Sheraton improve their brand of tolietries. But rooms quiet and clean. Empty mini fridge and coffee making facilities. Good gym: funny the cardio area is very spacious - so looks like they can add a few machines. Pool needs help: cold, freezing cold and doesnt look like its been cleaned in awhile. A wide lap pool against a wall with sprouting fountains. Dont think much for the swimming as opopsed to the looks since its freezing, dirty and has water spraying into the pool. With the wall, the sun is covered up most of the time into the pool. Laying around in the sun is better. Across the street is the Arizona Center - uncovered shopping Mall area. and right in downtown, so if you are wroking in the area, perfect. Wish they would slip you the bill through my hotel door overnight as opposed to having me check out in person. Overall very good hotel and recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant staff and presentation”
Reviews.Author: JimAPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Restaurant staff was friendly and very detail oriented. The breakfast presentation/choices/buffet was fantastic, fresh and tastey. Ryan was my server, but everyone I encountered was just great. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: capster9
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Downtown Phoenix is conveniently located in the middle of the city and their entire staff went out of their way to ensure everything went smoothly and that my stay was comfortable. The store in the lobby was well stocked with everything you need while on the road and the housekeeper (Amelia DeQueiroz) was really great in keeping my room well stocked and exceptionally clean during my week's stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful dining experience in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Attymatty
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to dinner as I had low expectations of "another hotel restaurant." As I also explained to my waitress, Narah Bradley, I do not like to dine in restaurants alone, which I had to do that evening. That meal turned out to be one of the highlights of my trip. The food was simply delicious, the staff were very attentive. I was having trouble deciding what to order, my waitress guided me through to a wonderful selection of salad, soup, and bbq pork sliders, which her wine recommendation paired with perfectly. The salad I ordered was new to the menu (with pear and walnuts). A manager came by to explain how it was prepared and ask how I liked it. As good as the food was, Narah was even better, she really made me comfortable--like I wasn't dining alone. Wonderful waitress, wonderful food, certainly NOT "another hotel restaurant."

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service by Narah Bradley @ The District Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Binarysunset
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on vacation in Phoenix and found The District through Urban Spoon and Chowhound. The place certainly lived up to its high reviews. Narah was not only friendly, but very enthusiastic about the menu choices and could easily recommend local beer and wine pairings. The food was divine. well proportioned, and a great value for the quality. Overall, I would highly recommend the place and Narah as a server.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: usastarfish
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights during a convention of 6500 people. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left the service was amazing. Each employee seemed happy to be there and caring for you. One employee that stood out, as he made our last moments less stressful and got us on our way was Christopher A.

Reviews.Title: “This is an underserviced overcrowded hotel: unless you have to be near the convention center, run don't walk away.”
Reviews.Author: NBDad
Reviews.Content: During a recent three night mid-week stay at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel, I was frankly shocked at the lack and quality of service at this hotel. This is an enormous hotel with an unfortunate layout (4 elevators to service 400 + rooms), but it is the woefully inadequate staffing that is the real problem. There were long lines to check-in every afternoon/evening snaking through the already over crowded lobby bar area and each check-in transaction seemed to take a very long time. I experienced very long waits to place an order with room service even after 9 pm (and the hotel has no voice mail feature so a guest who gets a busy message has to call back over and over rather than leaving a message for room service to be call the guest back) and corresponding long waits for room service food. There were waits for breakfast at the single restaurant in the hotel because while there were many empty tables, they were dirty and had not been bussed. Even getting a drink in the one hotel bar area before dinner is an ordeal because of inadequate and slow wait staff. Clearly the hotel's target market are the hordes of convention-goers who are a captive market for events at the nearby convention center and the attitude is clearly to do the absolute minimum to service that crowd. The lack of service for the room price was striking, as was the ridiculously expensive wireless internet in the rooms. As someone who travels to downtown Phoenix on business on a regular basis, I will not make the mistake of staying at this hotel and being treated like cattle. There are plenty of better hotels for business travelers in the nearby city center and Biltmore area a short distance from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnSGilbert_Az
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions. I have never been let down. The service is excellent, from the time you pull up to the valets to park your car, to the check in, and the servers in the bar and restaurant. I have been especially impressed with one server, Maggie. She has been our server on multiple occasions. She is efficient, knowledgeable, and always looks like she is enjoying what she is doing. Even on occasions when we have had a different server, she will take the time to clear the dishes off our table. Overall she has a great attitude and seems to be a team player. The beds and linens are comfy, the gym has great equipment, and the food is delicious. I recently had to stay at the Wyndham as this hotel was booked and I was completely disappointed. The hotel itself is within walking distance to many other restaurants and is a short walk or pedicab ride to watch the Suns or Diamondbacks play.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Phoenix Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtmbf50
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 day stay at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown. I needed to stay downtown for a conference at the convention center and found this hotel to be top notch. The service from everyone we encountered was outstanding - from the valet parking to the bellmen to the front desk folks. Kristin, a concierge, not only was personable and friendly but she never steered us wrong - all of her recommendations were spot on with what we were looking for. In all honesty, I have stayed at the Ritz Carlton & Four Seasons & the service here was every bit as good! Hotel itself is on the newer side, impeccably clean and 1 1/2 blocks from the Phoenix convention center. We had a corner room on the 27th floor. I had read the corner rooms were oversized but I really don't think that is true - we did have a larger bathroom but that's it. The rooms are an OK size with a large desk and flat screen TV. I must admit the closet & clothes area was a bit on the small side. It looks like an armoire built into the wall with a small closet area sitting above 2 smallish drawers. And that was all the room offered for storage - which is just fine for a short stay but there were 2 of us there for 5 days and I had both business & play clothes so it was a bit cramped. The room was tastefully appointed and extremely quiet - I never heard a sound from outside the door. Valet parking was $25/day or self park for $19. We used the valet and the car was always ready by the time we walked out the door. The District Bar was fun place to have a drink - we ate at the restaurant and we were not at all impressed. Service was good, but I thought the menu was limited in scope and the food was only just OK. They have a Starbucks cafe for morning coffee. Housekeeping was excellent. Fitness Center was large with more cardio equipment than I have seen in other hotels along with weights and machines. Pool was more of a lap pool and there was hot tub. I didn't use the pool but did go to the Fitness Center every day. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again - excellent hotel with superior service from everyone we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: DavidandKim
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a conference at the Convention Center. The Sheraton was about 1 block away. Very nice rooms, great service. Great place to stay. Just a couple of blocks from both basketball and baseball.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomal bar service in the not hotel bar.”
Reviews.Author: jaxxalope
Reviews.Content: During my week long stay I visited the lounge area next to the hotel and received fantastic service from Tearsa. She was always tentative and friendly while she waited on me and my friends. Drinks were reasonably priced and always delicious. Tearsa was always honest with how the food and drinks were. She definitely needs to get a raise and/or promotion. Others on the bar staff were equally as friendly as they passed by and weren't afraid to start up a genuine conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Jesse110680
Reviews.Content: I recommend the freindly and great service of the staff at the bar. If you're looking for inexpensive drinks, great service, and a nice atmosphere this is the place to go. I would like to give credit to Bradley Brock and Joni Huddleston for their excellent and friendly service to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for locals or travelers to get together”
Reviews.Author: JackHensley
Reviews.Content: We work in the area and visit the bar on occasion for cocktails. The servers are always friendly and attentive and have a knack for remembering your drink preference- always key in turning the impersonal atmosphere you find in many hotel bars into something more comfortable. Maggie's particularly adept at this on the floor as are Joanie and James behind the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Staff pays attention to return customers”
Reviews.Author: jmh0171
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Downtown PHX is a great hotel all around. It is centrally located, has great rooms/beds, full workout center, excellent restaurant menu, and the staff is outstanding. Everyone from the valet service to the front desk to the bar/restuarant staff takes the time to get to know return customers and make their experience better. Bradley Brock, of the District 9 restaurant/bar is always there with a handshake and a conversation. In addition to being an excellent bartender, he always makes time to chat about whats going on, no matter how busy the bar is. He, among others, makes this my hotel of choice when visiting Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Great cocktail waitress”
Reviews.Author: andy65432999
Reviews.Content: After a pleasant dinner at a nearby restaurant a colleague and I had a nightcap at the lobby bar at the Shearaton Phoenix Downtown Hotel. Lauren Witte served us and was extremely pleasant and personable. Took the time to let us sample some gin before ordering the right one and told us the best joke we've heard in years. If you go, ask Lauren what the opposite of Christopher Reeves is......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mcatkoala11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff (Jerry Vandusen), comfortable bed, and clean rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome dinner”
Reviews.Author: Busytraveler6
Reviews.Content: Dinner in the hotel was above awesome. The food and wine and especially the server Narah exceeded expectations

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - clean, hip and wonderful friendly service”
Reviews.Author: trippytraveler12
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel all summer long for business and its one of the best hotels I have stayed in. I don't know if its because is new (I am told around a year old) but its very clean, set up nicely. The best part is the staff - everyone from the parking valets, to the greeters to the wait staff (Maggie Reber-Wynn - you are the best!), the experience has been consistently great. I would highly recommend this hotel if you need to be in downtown Phx.

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenated my previous affinity for Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: SharmaGirl
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago, I selected the Sheraton RiverWalk in Chicago for a business trip that extended four nights. Upon check-in at 11pm, I entered a filthy room with peeling wallpaper etc. at the regular high price so I moved to a Fairmont. In 2005, my husband and I were married and had a reception at a Sheraton so I was very disappointed and have not stayed at once since. My customer booked me at the Sheraton Downtown Phoenix. From the moment of exiting arriving, I was wowed by Chris providing options for walking and shopping, was then wowed by Tyler who loaned me his personal phone charger and continued to be wowed by William G. in the restaurant who made me feel like a 5 star guest in a 5 star restaurant. The rooms are fabulous, the atmosphere of the entire hotel is open. They offer many healthy choices including organic vodka (healthy of sorts!)

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Experience/Watch out Ritz-Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: parisflygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel will blow you away. Their staff, their facilities, the rooms, the restaurant, amenities! Who would have thought that downtown Phoenix would have what it takes to make you NOT miss Scottsdale/Paradise Valley. Of course Scottsdale and Paradise Valley have lots of gorgeous resorts with superb golf but you must try downtown Phoenix for a very different upscale experience. The WOW factor is evident in this gorgeous place. My first impression was the carefully selected staff members. From the time that I stepped out of the car to the end of my stay, I found the staff to be extremely customer service oriented. Eye contact, sincere greetings and friendliness are the norm here. It is a Starwood Group Hotel, so it is run differently than your normal Sheraton. It is very Ritz-Carlton in ambiance and the lobby is gorgeous. Modern, sleek, open, spacious, immaculate. There is a lovely cafe', lobby bar and the front desk is very European in it's vibe. The bell staff, security people and managers greet everyone and make you feel very welcome. The rooms are comfortable and well equipped. Quiet is something that I have to have when sleeping and it exceeded my expectations. Blackout curtains, fabulous bed, fridge, Starbucks coffee in the room really made my stay wonderful. The restaurant is fabulous and has a resort style breakfast buffet that will help you start your day. Again, the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating in the restaurant. If you need a PC, they have lobby PC's available free of charge for guests. All have huge plasma screens. Want an inexpensive cup of coffee and a snack? They have that in the lobby cafe'. The City of Phoenix has done a slam dunk job of rehabilitating this area and the ASU Campus is within walking distance. Across the street, you will find great restaurants, shops and an AMC 24 Theatre. You can take the Light Rail to Tempe and Mesa if necessary. The hotel will give you a walking map of the city, so that you can try some wonderful restaurants within a 3-4 block area. Go to Brick/Urban Kitchen across the street for some of the best happy hour appetizers that you will ever experience. Superb Sangrias and interesting cheese selections at moderate prices. I love this place and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Quality and Location!”
Reviews.Author: luvintootravel
Reviews.Content: During this tough economy, we were happy with the quality of care from everyone in this hotel. From greetings at the curb to service of the housekeeping staff, all of the Sheraton personel were top notch. The location was very convenient to nice restaurants for evening dining.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the District - Maggie”
Reviews.Author: KenAbaca
Reviews.Content: I was attending a business function at the District (restaurant) and I was surprised to have such great service from our server. Our server was Maggie Reber-Wynn. She had maybe 30 people in my party and she did wonderful. I couldn't have asked for better service. The food and drinks were perfect! I couldn't ask for more. I am recommending my other organizations that I am part of to hold their functions at the District at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights for...”
Reviews.Author: jtrent00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights for an industry conference and found everything at the hotel from room to food to ballrooms to even the public bathrooms to be very clean. The staff was great and had great service from everyone especially Maggie at the lobby bar. She was very friendly and made sure we never had to search for her when more drinks were needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. Fun and Organized”
Reviews.Author: cshiroma1
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for a 4 day conference and had a great stay.. The rooms were nice and beds were comfortable. The hotel catered multiple buffets for our group and the food was good (much better than most buffet style lunches/dinners). The highlight of the hotel is the District restaurant/bar/lounge area. Our server, Maggie Reber-Wynn, gave us excellent service and was very friendly. She made sure that our needs were met and made us all feel welcome with her bubbly demeanor. There is nothing like a great experience like that to make the trip memorable. All in all, a good place to stay in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “The service, particularly that of Shawn Jeffries, was the best I have ever received.”
Reviews.Author: sgrogers
Reviews.Content: Staying in Phoenix was highlighted by the excellent amenities, food and without question, the outstanding service that was received at the Sheraton downtown Phoenix hotel. The bellmen, particularly Shawn Jeffries, were so helpful in finding restaurants, supplying us with endless water bottles (it was 110 degrees!) and just being extremely customer service oriented- very impressive! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Again, another overcharged, irritating, experience at another Sheraton.”
Reviews.Author: lhcguy
Reviews.Content: My experience at this Sheraton was exactly the same as my experience at the Sheraton in Newport Beach, after a long drive (3 hours plus), I pull into Valet and get informed that there will be a $25 charge to Valet, I'm like what? I am over paying for the room as it is!. Then there is only one person at the front desk to check in a line of 5 people as I walked in. Front desk guy very professional and checks me in, very helpful and polite. I get to my room, its clean nothing exceptional, wanted to lesson to some tune while I unpacked, forgot my ipod in the car so I turned on the t.v, Get this $4 to hear music on the set for 2 hours, go to get in the shower, all good, till I go to dry off, the towels felt like sandpaper. it actually hurt to dry off. so, went to up my laptop to check emails, guess what another fee, $12.95 for 12 hours. my point to all this is this Hotel Chain nickel and dimes you to death after you pay more for a room that many, may other hotels just as nice or nicer provides at a much fairer price. Very Disappointing

Reviews.Title: “One of the most phenomenal hotel experiences I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: sanlynch2010
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay was perfect from the moment I checked in. The staff went out of their way to make us feel like VIPs. I love the idea of placing "ambassadors" at points in the hotel to greet you and welcome you back when you've been off property. The rooms were lovely and the beds comfortable. The health facility was wonderful and free -- just as it should be. The District Restaurant food and service was amazing. Also, Shawn Jeffries was a big bright spot. Right after we checked in, we were given a full tutorial on restaurants within walking distance. He also alerted us to the guys with the orange shirts, provided us with water (much needed!!) everytime we left and returned to the hotel and was extremely friendly and helpful. He is a great PR guy for the Sheraton and the Sheraton Phoenix. I definitely want to come back to the Sheraton when I'm in Phoenix again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very attentive and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: achidsey
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with 2 great bars in the lobby, and is located just a block from the convention center. There was a uniformed staff member at every turn and all were extremely friendly. Bed, bedding and pillows were luxurious and comfortable. Room service was also above average. I will be going back to this hotel for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sheraton I've ever stayed in by far”
Reviews.Author: TheN0rtherner
Reviews.Content: I had an extremely pleasant and enjoyable stay at the Sheraton in dowtown phoenix. By far, this is the best Sheraton I have stayed in, and I would not hesitate to book my stay here, when I return to downtown Phoenix. In my opinion the downtown Phoenix Sheraton should be a model and example for all other Sheratons. The agent who checked me in was very welcoming, friendly and pleasant, all associates say hello to you when you walk past them through the lobby, rather than just staring down their screens and ignoring you which happens at most other hotels! Also my favorite part about the hotel is the District. As well as being a fantastic environment and atmosphere, there is a great selection of microbrew beers, the food there is really good and the bar staff are also very friendly, welcoming and attentive. Breakfast was great too. It was a really good selection at the breakfast bar, and the staff who served me for breakfast were very polite and courteous, which means a lot in a day and an age where ‘pleases’ and ‘thank yous’ are scarce. On some mornings, I had 2 staff serving me and I assumed one was in training, but both members of staff were as polite and courteous as each other, which is a credit to both their existing staff and new hires. With the free breakfast / free appetizer, room upgrade, and personalized greetings, I truly felt that I fully experienced my SPG Platinum benefits too. My positive experiences at the hotel ensured that I went to work with a positive, confident attitude each day, ready to take on the day’s challenges,

Reviews.Title: “Business trip - Great - would stay here for pleasure also”
Reviews.Author: TheBoosh123
Reviews.Content: Many cities, many miles, many business hotel stays - suffice to say, I am not easily impressed. A pleasant surprise with this hotel. Yes, it's Phoenix (downtown, so no golf, and Summer heat, etc) but amenities, cleanliness, attention to detail, etc., make this hotel feel more 'Leisure Like' than business stay. Most business hotels have 'rather be somewhere else' staff but here, the general attitude was 'eager to please'; I LIKE working here; how can I help YOU, etc. Of note was a last minute business dinner for 6 at the restaurant and the supervisor or manager, I believe a Mr. Rose, embodied the above attributes and "made' the evening for us. Don't know what their 'formula' is, but other hotels should take note.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: R_Brown_MD
Reviews.Content: Quality you would expect of the Sheraton, but the true quality was the customer service. From check-in, when I received an upgraded room, until check-out, the service was excellent. The hotel staff was friendly and always willing to lend a hand. I especially want to commend Narah Brandley, who works in the District Restaurant. She was excellent--friendly, made great recommendations from the peach sangria to the dessert, and even made a fresh pot of coffee to go along with my dessert. I will definitely stay here again if I am in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Ken Kriske is the very best”
Reviews.Author: Hayden31310
Reviews.Content: Sheraton – down town Pheonix, AZ Mr. Leo Percopo, We park in your garage and attend the baseball games. Because of your unselfishness we have enjoyed the beautiful surroundings of the downtown Phoenix Sheraton. We are drawn to your facility to dine and drink when we are looking for superior service and quality food. The other night we were sitting by two men who were so impressed with the service they received from Ken Kriske; they asked for a stuffed olive. Ken went to the kitchen and stuffed two olives and placed them in their martinis. This is the service that has become germane to us. I have learned Ken Kriske may be changing positions within Sheraton. We will miss his great service; however, Elsa and I are very hopeful that Ken Kriske is placed in a position to aggrandize his talents and add extra value to you. We wish you the very best. Keep up the great work. If you need expert water treatment, filtration and purification please call me. Respectfully, Brian Hayden Boyett

Reviews.Title: “Simply a wonderful place to gather with friends.”
Reviews.Author: dtsmoothington
Reviews.Content: Recently I attended a meeting at the Sheraton Phoenix Down. The staff was outstanding and the facilities were fabulous. We held our meeting in the District Dining area. Although the entire staff are worthy of praise I want to single out Cliff Rose for really standing out. We was caring, concerned about our service and just plain the consummate Professional. It was an absolute joyful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel1013
Reviews.Content: I can not begin to say enough great things about the staff of the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown. From the employees at the front desk, Tom and Felisa, to the bellman, Dex, this staff is extraordinary. The Front Desk Manager, Jeffrey Gardner went above and beyond to make my colleague and I stay’s one of superb comfort and unsurpassed generosity. Our suite was extremely immaculate and the entire facility was very clean and inviting to guest. Lastly, I would like to rave about the District Restaurant inside the hotel. Our waiter, Jeff was very friendly and made sure we were greeted by name and very well taken care of. In closing, you will not be disappointed or regret staying with the fine folks of the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown. I would not hesitate for one second to recommend to any of my friends, family or anyone to experience this fabulous hotel. Thank you, Belinda Rogers

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lrev1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had such high hopes for our 2 night stay. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed. We are Phoenix residents, who decided to spend our 20th anniversary vacation in town, and contribute to the local economy. Although the bed was comfy (nice pillows, too), our stay on the Club Level was a major let down. From check-in, I became nervous that our stay was not going to be the experience it was represented to be on the Sheraton website. The employee who checked us in informed us that the club level lounge wasn't available for breakfast on Sunday (huge bummer!). She tried to compensate for this with free appetizer coupons for the District restaurant. Check in took forever! The "lounge" was lame--so not worth the extra money we paid for it. Then there was the pool. There was no poolside service (on a weekend in July!). We had to call for a drink...then wait. And wait. Terrible! The whole pool area was so uninviting. After one drink, we gave up. The next night, we went to the on-site restaurant (District) to use our appetizer coupons. They were tasty, and the half-price bottles of wine were nice, but our server was only marginally interested in seeing to our needs. Monday morning, before we checked out, we went to grab some breakfast in the lounge. It was just about what we had come to expect: an average continental breakfast, not worth the price we paid for our stay. Room service was way overpriced: a BLT salad, macaroni and cheese, and a cheeseburger: $65! Not including tip! Overall: disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, Friendly and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: j889814672
Reviews.Content: Nice downtown location. Easy access and helpful valet service if you drive. Check in and check out are fast. Staff is helpful and friendly... they go out of their way. Starbucks coffee shop in lobby was great. Very affordable. Fantastic gym with ample brand new life fitness equipment. Definitely one to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VT777
Reviews.Content: Staying here right now.... Great hotel. Very modern, clean, upscale. Its downtown close to many a beautiful urban park area with quite a few restaurants. The gym is large and well-appointed. My room has a fantastic view. I just came from a Marriott in Orlando - noisy, crowded and tired.... this place is a breath of fresh air. Great for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased beyond measure!”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind46
Reviews.Content: I've been in quite a few hotels because of my job, attending conferences etc. and this was the most pleasurable by far. The attention to detail was what surprised me the most. I asked for additional creamers and sugars for my room at the coffee center and they not only left it that day but left more for the entire week. I didn't have to ask again. The room was beautiful, cool, clean and inviting. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful from check in, to entertaining my "tourist questions" to check out and printing my boarding pass for me. I also ate breakfast at the counter near the computers and it was great. Enjoyed the movie theatre and restaurants across the street too. I truly have not enjoyed that well rounded of a stay in a long time! Thanks so much Sheraton, excellent job.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, overall experience.”
Reviews.Author: 2Italylovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a conference in Phoenix and stayed at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown. The hotel was very clean, great location, and the staff were extremely friendly with efficient check in and out. Close to great restaurants like Matt's Big Breakfast and the Phoenix Public Market.

Reviews.Title: “Polite Service and Nice Extras”
Reviews.Author: LindseyMac
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and found this to be one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The entire staff was polite and friendly. They were always available. I really enjoyed getting $5 vouchers for food if I did not need my room cleaned that day. The conference rooms were very nice and the food in the restaurant was very good. It is close to other restaurants and some shopping. It is also walking distance to Chase Field and the convention center. It is a good location if you need to be in downtown Phoenix. I would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Horible mistreat!!”
Reviews.Author: GrAbr
Reviews.Content: In December 2009, more than 2 months in advance, I made a reservation for my February 28th - March 2nd, 2010 (3 days/2 nights) business trip to Phoenix, AZ for the annual Subcommittee meeting. Just as the other members, I was advised to stay at the Sheraton Downtown Phoenix Hotel since the meeting room and other events were scheduled there. The reservation and all payments were made through the Expedia in December. In January my credit card was charged in full and a reservation confirmation was issued. I was surprised that I was charged in full that early. Normally, hotels do it at the check-out, but I said to myself “It’s OK”. At this point at least I was absolutely sure that I am all set and can fully concentrate on my business. In the morning of February 28, lesser than 8 hours before the flight, I suddenly received an e-mail asking to immediately contact the hotel. When I called, the receptionist told me that my reservation has been cancelled. Below is approximate phone conversation, as I recall it: - Sorry Sir but your reservation has been canceled. - I made my reservation in December last year specifically far enough in advance to be sure that I’m at the same hotel as the rest of my team and I have everything I need for my business! - Sir we’re overloaded, and we have to cancel your reservation. We have a situation when people staying in our hotel decided to extend their stay and so we have to cancel your reservation. We can try to place you in another hotel if you wish. - No, I do not want you to place me in another hotel and I will have my room tonight! - We will try our best Sir, but we can’t guarantee you a room. There are many(!) cancellations we’re going through right now. Sorry… I hang up and called Expedia. They were shocked and tried to call the hotel but came back with the same result. All the conversations took total of more than 2 hours crashing all my last-minute trip preparations. Finally, somebody from the Expedia management called me and said that situation has been partially resolved – I may stay in Sheraton for 1 night. I accepted the change expressing my deepest dissatisfaction (a real anger, actually). When I arrived to the Sheraton, I was confirmed that I have one night only. I asked if my stay can be extended for the 2nd night and was informed that the chances are slim to none. Only the direct interaction of the SME top administration changed the situation and I was offered to stay for the 2nd night. As a mining engineer heaving behind my shoulders decades of traveling experience throughout the United States and abroad, I have stayed in all kind of hotels, motels and other, but I was never treated this bad. I can not recall anything even close to the situation in which an administration of a hotel literally tried to throw a guest out from the hotel. But that’s exactly the case with Sheraton DT Phoenix. I’m sure that a hotel should not take a reservation and full payment in advance especially if there is no guaranty that the room will be available. But if they accepted the payment and issued a confirmation, than no matter what they have to perform their duties as obligated. Follow-up A few weeks later, after I complained to the Sheraton administration, they connected me to a customer service representative who explained me why all this happened. According to those explanations everything what happened is normal, routine situation. More than that, I’ve been informed that under the State of Arizona Law, hotel can not remove a guest from the room if it decided to stay longer. So, according to this law, Arizona hotels routinely cancel reservations of their upcoming guests. I don’t know, it’s probably OK to throw your quest out to the street, but from the Sheraton stand-point only. Personally, I do not think so. In addition to enormous mistreat of their guests, the hotel demonstrated their 100% careless customer service. This is an absolutely unacceptable business, Mr. Phoenix DT Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: kdansereau
Reviews.Content: hotel staff were very accomodating, and pleasant.. bellman Christopher was great, easy check in check out. beautiful view from our room. Very clean, comfy beds. close to everything downtown (convention center, us airways center, chase field-- all in walking distance!) Beautiful pool area. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: hmw920
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here on business. The hotel was nice and new, the service was fairly strong, and if they had anything to do with the catered lunches, those were pretty strong too. I didn't know Sheratons were this nice. This is obviously not a St. Regis or some sort of five star hotel, so I didn't give it a five, but I gave it a four because it is basically as good as it can be for standard business travel/conference hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, location, staff and amenities, nice addition to Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: travelguy028
Reviews.Content: I am a Sheraton guy, and travel allot for both business and pleasure so not easily impressed, but this Hotel made an impression !!! Beautiful rooms, comfortable beds and great service staff. This will be my choice from now on whenever I travel to Phoenix. Best "Link" I have seen very roomy, great Starbucks bar, could spend all day there working. First class fitness center also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business/Leisure. Not good for families. GREAT Service”
Reviews.Author: Tzankster
Reviews.Content: Overall great property for convention or business. PROS-- Service is exceptional, particularly their concierge staff. Room is comfortable and stylish with comfortable beds and flatscreen TVs Location is great for convention center, baseball, basketball arenas, movies, live theater and some great restaurants. Our favorites were the Greek and Mexican place across the street and the Thai Elephant about 10 minutes walk away thru a nice area. Rooms are super clean and quiet. Exercise facility is outstanding and they don't charge extra to use it. If you chose to not have daily cleaning service you can get Sheraton points or a $5 certificate for the bar. CONS-- Internet is $13/day. Closet/drawer space is very limited. There is no refrigerator or microwave. Parking is very expensive Hotel itself does not have many eating options so you have to venture out for lunch during your conference in AZ heat. Pool is small and more geared for adults. If you enjoy a quiet relaxing experience this is it but if you have kids they may require more. Hotel breakfast is expensive. If you have kids better to stay at the Marriott Fairfield up the street with free breakfast. If you are on business and can add it to your room, Lynx Cafe is fine for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, beautiful & relaxing pool/work out facility & a great restaurant! rant”
Reviews.Author: nnnnmom
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I was treated wonderfully! The room was beautiful overlooking the amazing pool! I enjoyed working out in a top-notch work- out facility. Room service was great including pool side delivery! When I decided to explore the city I was given excellent advice on where to eat and sites to visit as well as how best to get there. What was a business trip turned into more of a vacation due to the excellent service I received during my stay at the lovely Phoenix Sheraton. The only negative was having to pay for in- room internet service. It was free for a small time frame in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, First Class, Fun Place”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadHealthDoc
Reviews.Content: Everything is brand spanking new and works. Housekeeping service was excellent, as well as room service. Very convenient to Convention Center. Bed and pillows very comfortable. The activity in the lobby is brisk nightly and a fun place to hang out with friends. Health club is very nice. Business center has free online computer use and many stations. Never had to wait. Thoroughly enjoyed stay.

Reviews.Title: “okay, not bad, not great.”
Reviews.Author: beachtravel
Reviews.Content: Check was easys, the bell people were friendly, the room was ok. There just wasnt anything to make me want to return. I was here for a conference and I just got the feeling that it is a very generic hotel with not too many repeat travelers. The next time I come to Phoenix I'd rent a car and stay at one of the nicer resorts for a few dollars more and really enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, poor customer service and maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Batman75
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton downtown phoenix is not a bad place to stay, although I prefer to stay at the Hyatt Regency even though I am a Starwood Platinum Preferred Guest and enjoy amenities for that at the Sheraton. The property itself is very nice. Rooms are modern and well decorated. It has a viable restaurant as far as Starwood Hotels go. There is a nice pool. The lobby is also very nice. The colors and decor throughout the hotel is friendly and warm, which makes this hotel a pleasant place to stay. The beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are also well done. While Sheraton is usually one of Starwood's lesser brands, this Sheraton is pretty much Westin quality as far as the rooms go. There are 3 issues though which reduce my rating: 1) Service. I have had several issues with service in this hotel and get the impression they don't really care about customer satisfaction. One is the room service dining. I have on multiple occassions tried to order chocolate cake with a scoop of ice cream. They won't give me a scoop of ice cream because it isn't in the description and insist on charging an extra $8 to buy an entire pint of ice cream. However, they do serve single a single scoop of ice cream with the apple pie. This intransigence is completely ridiculous, and non service oriented. Also the doormen never offer to carry your luggage to the room unless you actually ask them. 2) Treatment of loyal guests. I used to stay at this hotel every week. However, there were a number of occassions during conferences where they were busy and charged higher prices for the rooms (which were nonetheless still available). I asked the front desk if they could give me the usual corporate rate since I am a regular guest and they refused saying they were sold out at the corporate rate. 3) Maintenance. Most of the shower heads in this hotel are clogged at the edges which means instead of getting a cone-shaped spray from the shower head, you get a narrow spray which means you need to move around a lot in the shower. This could easily be fixed, and I don't understand why they don't just do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Downtown Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: anuday05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton due to my mom attending a Capella University conference being held at this hotel. Since it was the entire family 3 adults/1 child, I decided to book a 1bdrm Suite with club level lounge access and was grateful for the additional space and the club level perks of being on the 30th floor and access to free breakfast and appetizers in the evening. EVERY staff I came across was pleasant and helpful, but this REALLY is a buisness hotel with over 1000 rooms. They are very very busy, but it never felt to crowded. The food and drinks are muy expensivo! One drink cost me $18! So I suggest walking across the street and going to Hooters or one of the 6 other restaurants within walking distance. PROS- large spacious room! Great views! Helpful staff! Close to everything downtown...you can easily walk to everything from here. GREAT JAZZ Band Saturday night!
