They were jammin playing Marvin Gaye and other classics all night long! NEVER felt crowed, elevators were quick and efficient. p.s. I slept on the sofasleeper, but my parents LOVED the bed. They even checked the mattress name so they could buy it CONS- Checkout took 25min! I was really urked by this! Room not the cleanist, I found long strands of hair throughout my stay all through the room ( bathroom sink, on the towels, carpet) I have a phobia about other people hair so this kinda grossed me out. Had to keep getting my room key, rekeyed because it wouldnt allow me to access the club lounge ( later found out they were having mechanical issues with the door) p.s. Parking is $18 a day, and internet is NOT FREE in the room..i think its around $12, but you can access it free in the lobby All in all i would definitely stay here if I were in Phoenix again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value at $125/night conference rate”
Reviews.Author: Nitt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for the Capella University commencement ceremonies at the Phoenix Convention Center. Very pleased with accommodations. TIP: forego housecleaning for a day and get a $5 coupon good in the lobby bar or the District dining room. Concierge was very helpful, giving us maps that highlighted the sites we wanted to see and recommending ground transportation. Greeted at the sally port by a porter dedicated to getting bags up to your room. Link Cafe in the lobby nice for a quick, pick-up breakfast and free access to the internet--on your laptop or their desktop. Check-in and check-out effortless. Loved that we were near so many sites and restaurants. Actually wished we could stay a couple more nights. Busy with multiple conference attenders but also saw families. At no time did we feel crushed by crowds. Loved cheering on Northern Iowa with the group in the lobby bar. Live jazz weekends in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ToddB3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as the headquarters for PF Chang's Rock 'n Roll Marathon. Rooms arranged by Team in Training, with whom I was running for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: jfkadlec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to a meeting at the hotel. The meeting facilities were very good, and the audiovisual equipment good. The facilities for this type of meeting are excellent and help to make the meeting successful. The lobby is very spacious as are the open areas near the ballrooms. These areas are very attractive, clean and well lit. The hallways of the hotel are also well lit, attractive and clean. The room was somewhat small, but the size you expect in a large hotel in a metropolitan area. The bathroom was appropriate and the amenities generous. The room and bath were well furnished and clean. The heating and air conditioning system was good, and easily controllable. The internet service is pricey, but if you don't need to have it in your room, it is free in the lobby. The screens at the complimentary lobby computers are large, and the way things are programmed makes one comfortable with the system. Your browsing history is completely erased when you sign off. You may also use your laptop in the free computer area by Wi-Fi if you wish. Our check in was uncomplicated. The check in clerk was very accommodating and the service with our bags was also very good and accommodating. Right across the street is an open mall with many dining places and upscale shops. We found a wide choice of dining at very reasonable prices so did not eat at the hotel. Our experience with this hotel was first class, but you expect that for the price. We were not disappointed in our stay but there are hotels within a block or two for much less money. Bottom line is that this hotel is definitely a five star hotel, but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Super Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maestro
Reviews.Content: This is a great downtown / convention hotel. Here are my pros & cons: +Short taxi ride from the airport +Speedy, friendly check-in +Attractive, comfortable room with a 37” flat screen +Funky internet café in the lobby, serving $2.00 Starbucks coffee (small) and $2.50 bananas +Excellent food in the restaurant. 4 of us went for dinner, each had something different and it was all wonderful. Fabulous $16 breakfast buffet. +$60 cab ride to the Phoenix Coyotes hockey rink… what a stylin’ rink it is at that! NHL hockey tickets start at just $20 +The convention food is First Class. I had the honor of meeting the person responsible, the Executive Chef. +Large fitness center with lots of cardio and resistence equipment -Overcharged by more than 30% on my $82 laundry bill. Too bad, so sad. Aside from my laundry overcharge, this is a great hotel that I look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Clean Hotel for Business, Great Location, Close To Airport”
Reviews.Author: funhole
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights for a business convention. It's centrally located downtown and it's about 20 minutes from the Phoenix airport. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and was able to handle a large convention crowd of people checking in and out very quickly. They were efficient and got you your room key very quickly. The room key worked on the first try also. They really knew their jobs and the hotel wisely had several extra front desk clerks to handle the first day check in load. The entrance to the hotel has a large, covered valet area reminiscent of hotels in Las Vegas. There are quite a few capable valets eager to help you with your car/bags but were not overbearing, etc. There is also parking below the hotel that is accessed from this front area. The room I stayed in was your typical business room, a somewhat tight, rectangular room but comfortable and very clean. Everything appeared to be brand new and the bathroom seemed to be recently updated. I was on the 14th floor and it had a nice view of the city and the mountains in the distance. My room had two queen beds which were very comfortable with alot of different types of pillows. There was a desk area and coffee station in the room along with Wi-Fi to access the Internet. (It was provided free to us during the convention but I'm not sure if you are charged as a regular traveler) There was a closet to hang clothes and dressers/nightstands, etc. The hotel provided our convention with breakfast and lunch and the food was excellent. The convention areas are massive and are located on the 2nd and 3rd floors, the lodging rooms above that. There is bar in the lobby that has lounge chairs, etc. to mingle and other restaurants but the drink prices were high at the hotel bar. There is a small convenience store located in the lobby area as well as free Internet printing kiosks so that you can print out documents like boarding passes, etc before heading out to the airport. If you are a sports fan, you are walking distance to the Diamondback's baseball stadium and the Sun's US Airways Arena. The hotel is about 25 minutes to the Cardinal's football stadium and about 30 minutes to Scottsdale. The only downside to this hotel would be the elevators. When the place is fully loaded with a conference, there is sometimes a considerable wait to get an elevator especially if you are on an upper floor especially during break times or the end of a day. But, Phoenix is a weird town. It's a clean, safe city but there are no people walking around. It's dead both during the day and night. Even though you are "downtown", it doesn't seem like there's ever anything going on. The hotel is located near the Univ. of AZ downtown campus, but we didn't see that many college students. We found some restaurants didn't open until 5pm. One night, we went to a sports bar called Majerle's about a block from the US Airways Arena where a Sun's basketball game was going on. In the bar, there were only a few people there besides us and the area around the arena was a ghost town. It's almost like a Neutron bomb went off where the buildings are left standing but there are no people left. The weather was great that week in the 80s. There's very little traffic around town so getting to and from places is very easy. Overall, it's a comfortable, clean hotel for business travelers and conventioneers . The location is close to the airport and the city downtown. Phoenix itself was somewhat disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, educated staff, even nice green elements”
Reviews.Author: DHofferCG
Reviews.Content: As a "green" hospitality/marketing professional I am always looking for those programs that exemplify social responsibility in a hotel or resort. I stayed at this property for a week and must say from the staff to the level of service provided everything was very nice. I especially loved the $5 credit per night by participating in their towl and linen program. They are a short one block walk to the convention center and across from great restaurants. A great business hotel, just a short ride from the airport. I'd love to see them get rid of their plastic water bottles in their guest rooms to really further their green efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! An Example of Heroic Hospitality at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: RWCole
Reviews.Content: I'm a gen. mgr. of a small northern Michigan Best Western and I've gotta let readers know how this hotel's staff impressed me. Every encounter from bellmen, front desk, concierge, housekeepers, and Stacy in the Club Lounge were very professional and you could really tell they enjoyed their jobs. I spent a good hour chatting with Stacy and this gal is going places. I hope Leo (the gen. mgr.) is paying her well cause I told her if she can stand the snow in the winter she can have a job at our hotel. She is just bubbling with personality and you can truly tell how much she loves working there. She told me about how much her gen. mgr. does for his staff, his humble beginnings, and how much they love him. That really impressed me and I told her she embodies what we at our hotel call "heroic hospitality". I hope you really appreciate the asset you have, she's a gem. I also want to tell you about a housekeeper, and I hope I spell her name correctly, Shaquel. Late around 11 pm I stepped out of my room to find a snack and she happened to be right outside my door way going into their employee break room. I asked where the snack machines was and she asked what I was looking for. I replied, something like a candy bar. She said they had them in the break room and would go get me one. I asked how much, grabbed her the money, and in a flash she was back with a Snickers and then handed me a bottle of water to wash it all down. Above and beyond on service! She could easily have brushed me off and sent me down the hall or whereever they keep the snack machines for guests, but instead, took a few minutes out of her job to impress a guest. These are just two examples of the staff amongst many I encountered. I know they may feel like they are just "doing their job", but being a guest, instead of the general manager, inspired me to be sure these little things are not overlooked at our hotel. Leo, you have a wonderful bunch of people, and from the spotless rooms, and everything else I encountered you will do well and I have no hesitation recommending this hotel, especially if you travel on business. Keep up the great job, and tell Stacy she is always welcome to come to Traverse City, MI and we will have a job waiting for her! Russ W. Cole, General Manager, Best Western Four Seasons. Sorry, earlier review got deleted because I didn't see email about verifying ownership.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel in a business city”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and used the hotel for sleeping and breakfasting only. It provided everything I needed for a business trip and I found the staff to be helpful, efficient and a pleasure to deal with. It's very much a bustling business hotel and I would find it an unpleasant place to be for leisure, but since Phoenix has nothing to attract the leisure visitor this point is probably moot. The hotel is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but location not so great”
Reviews.Author: EleH
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a lovely hotel, not one i could afford myself but luckily I was there for a conference. Downtown is normally where the good bars & restaurants are but in the case of Phoenix downtown there is very little going on. You won't go hungry/thirsty but if it's shopping you want go elsewhere. Go to 'Olive & Ivy' in Scottsdale (~12 miles away) for great food and ornate restrooms.

Reviews.Title: “It's downtown it's close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Krytter
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Service? Well that's a mixed bag. Bad: The young woman that checked us in assured us that the room was not close to an elevator or vending. We always ask because we are light sleepers. Vending and ice were right across the hall. First impression - lousy. She also told us our room card would work in the parking lot. Also wrong. In fact, during the entire 5 day stay it worked a total of once, after being told repeatedly that it was programmed and would work. Good: When we went back down about the room and vending the young man that helped us got us into a nice corner room. The bathroom layout was weird, but hey, no noisy junk outside the door. The room had a great view of Camelback and my wife now knows why it has that name. While I was waiting one afternoon for my wife to exit a meeting I stopped and had a Guinness at the bar. I had a great conversation with a black gentleman whose name I have forgotten (I cannot remember names!), but impressed me greatly. I wish I would have had more time to talk with him. Cleanliness was okay. There were some paperclips and paper, etc in the hall on our floor for the whole stay. The room was very well cleaned. The restaurant, as expected was obnoxious in it's pricing. Especially considering there was a food court right across the street with plenty of good choices. Every time I walked by it was deserted. Management probably can't figure out why. The only reason I went this time was the opportunity to drive down to one of my brother's houses south of Tucson. If not for that I would have stayed home. I doubt I would stay here if I was paying. Rates are ridiculous or what is offered. I will recommend it to business travelers on an expense account, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: texan_world_traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff was ultra friendly for a large hotel. When I got lost I found my self being walked to where I needed to be by the staff several times. This hotel is a great location for nba and mlb games. There are many restraunts and a movie theater directly across the street. But this location seemed to be on the border of a rough area so be careful which direction you walk at night. The pool was great but could have used a waiter for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: MouseGirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton downtown, as my husband was attending a conference at the Convention Center which is conveniently located just down the street. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we were cheerfully given an early check-in upon request. The hotel is almost new (opened in fall 2008) and it still feels very fresh and new. Large, open spaces in the lobby and main floor. The pool is not huge, but was good for swimming laps and floating around in the 100 degree temperatures. The fitness center was fantastic and full of the latest equipment. Location-wise, if you weren't going to be attending an event at the convention center, options right around the hotel for shopping were pretty much limited to the Arizona Center across the street, which had some nice shops and lots of restaurants. Light rail access is only a couple of blocks away, which was great for exploring the rest of the city. Rooms were not huge, but were clean, well-equipped and kept nicely cool with a quiet air conditioning system. We would definitely return again if planning to stay in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: SurferBear
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the reception area we were greeted by a friendly, fast, efficient receptionist. She said "your room is waiting for you." We had a great view and the room was super clean. Stayed 5 nights and each day we discovered something more to enjoy inside the hotel as the heat outside was "super hot". Receiving $5 for reusing the linens was a great bonus for "going green." The food is the restaurant tasted as good as it looked. How refreshing to not look at a boring plate of food! Marveled at the cleanliness of the "huge" lobby area where there were a great many conventioneers milling around chatting & drinking cocktails. Thanks to the management for making this a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and Clean in the heart of NEW Downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: TheConstantTraveler3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in July where the temps rarely dropped below 96 degrees. The hotel is new and fresh, modern and reflects the Southwest surroundings. It's location is perfect for what we needed to do. We took in a D'backs game, walked to Chase. The hotel staff was terrific, there were 1200 of us conventioners and most of the stay went flawlessly. The only setback was at 5PM, when the entire 1200 of us were finished for the days meetings, three of the four elevators to take anyone past the 18th floor were not working. Thus creating an over 45 minute delay to get to our rooms. Climbing 26 flights in un-airconditioned stairwells was not an option. The room was fantastic, bed was very comfortable. However, early in the morning when a thousand guests need to shower, there is a loss of water pressure up on the top floors, although there was never a loss in the temp of the water. Overall, I would return, however, not in July!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel, in fact, I don't think my room had ever been used. The place was amazing. Staff, highly trained and efficient. There are 2 bars and a restaurant. All are fabulous. The rooms are large and the downtown location is central to the conference center. I would certainly stay here again (and have)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: x0me880x
Reviews.Content: Once again, I was in town for a concert. I knew I was not going to spend much time in the hotel as I was going to go straight from the airport, check in, then off to the venue. I had never been to Phoenix and was only there till the next morning. It was between this and the Hyatt and am very happy to have picked the downtown Sheraton. From the moment my driver pulled up I was greeted warmly, my bags where taken and the bellman proceded to welcome me to the hotel. While walking me to the front desk to check in he talked about how the hotel was just built in October, he told me about the wireless in the loby, the business center, the bar, etc. Check in was fast and easy and I then headed to my room. I was on the 6th floor and had a view of nothing but the building next to me, but that was ok, a view is not always important to me. The room was spacious, comfortable, and the bed was extremly comfy. I wish I could offer up a better review, but again I was not there much and didnt use any facilities they offer. I was blown away by the how kindly I was welcomed, and the entire hotel was just beautiful. This hotel does not offer free wifi in your room, but it is offered in the loby for hotel guests. They also offer computers with internet for hotel guests to use at there desire.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and central to conference”
Reviews.Author: SFCrabette
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference held downtown at the convention center. I was walking distance with several downtown restaurants including Sheraton's own to pick from. Options are more limited however and a car would be more helpful to get outside of the downtown area for better eating and shopping options. Everything was very clean and Sheraton's usually comfy bedding. Modern details throughout hotel and in room - clean lines, uncluttered. Staff was friendly. Options for valet park or self-parking. Self parking was $16/day. Overall I was quite pleased with my stay and enjoyed the accommodations. It is a higher quality Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Convenient to shopping, eating, and convention center”
Reviews.Author: S0thernbelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very very beautiful. I stayed here in May for a convention and I have to say it was extremely relaxing being in the hotel. The lobby bar is great, and the district restaurant is fabulous. The morning buffet is a must! The staff are always polite and enthusiastic, which was very welcome in a new city. The hotel is located right across from the Arizona center for shopping and eating, and just down the street from the convention center and several other restaurants. It is primely located to give you a great Phoenix experience. Request to stay on an upper floor just for the views. The elevators did a take a little while, but it's 31 floors. I never waited more than a minute or two for an elevator, when the hotel was almost full. I will say I was glad not to have to pay for anything, as the prices were a little expensive, but definitely worth it for a relaxing trip. If the food is too expensive simply walk across the street for plenty of other dining options. If you are a Sheraton preferred guest, they put you on your own floor, and on that floor, there are no charges for your water. The coffee in the room was great as well. The bed was SOOOO comfortable, and there's plenty of space to put your things. I stayed for a week, and actually wish I could've had a little more time in the room. They always restock your shampoos and soaps and coffee. This was a very very clean hotel and room. I would definitely recommend this hotel to ANYBODY.

Reviews.Title: “A great trip to Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: OmahaTravel
Reviews.Content: So the company finally sends me somewhere I want to go...no more of this small-town Nebraska stuff! Hello, Phoenix! Hotel was great for a Sheraton. New 8 months ago. Still looks it. The elevators are fast and efficient...I don't know what other reviewers were thinking! 8 elevators total (4 for 1-17 and 4 for 8-32); I never waited more than 1 minute for an elevator and the hotel was full. Pros: Attentive staff; from the bellhops to the front desk to maid service, they were all exceptional Bar in lobby is wonderful place to gather with colleagues Conference center is 2 blocks away and an easy safe walk Beds are the best of any hotel I've ever stayed at Across the street is an AMC theatre and small shopping area with lots of good places to eat Work out center is phenominal with all-new equipment Bigger bathroom than most hotels Cons: Parking is expensive and no free shuttle to/from airport No free breakfast No free wi-fi Small pool; I expected something more than a small rooftop for the desert climate Great place to stay if you have the change in your conference budget. I paid conference rate of $139/night. I would stay here again. And, as many of you know that have read my other reviews, I always stay at Hiltons when I can...Sheraton got this one right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for conventions/conferences”
Reviews.Author: DP301
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Downtown Sheraton. The hotel is conveniently situated just two blocks from the convention center, a few blocks from the Diamondbacks Stadium, and there are numerous dining options right across the street. The rooms were very clean and the beds amazingly comfortable. However, other than the eating/shopping center right across the street, the area is pretty dead. The only other complaint I have is that a hotel this size should really offer shuttle service to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “best bed i've ever slept in, bar none”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Mahon
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sheraton for 4 nights for a conference. the hotel was beautiful and rooms were nicely equipped and very clean. the bed was insanely comfortable. i might need to get one at home. staff were very helpful and friendly and the hotel was convenient to the convention center. the only problem with the hotel was the elevators, which keeps me from giving the hotel an "excellent" rating. there are two banks of four elevators each, and i understand that the hotel has 1000 rooms. i was on the 26th floor and one of the two banks of elevators services the higher floors. my friend who shared my room got stuck in an elevator at one point, as did several other people i knew. at one point three of the four elevators servicing the higher floors were inoperable. i suppose with a hotel that is less than a year old they are still working out the kinks, but this was a major inconvenience. we ended up taking an elevator from the other bank of elevators up to the 17th floor and then we climbed the stairs up to the 26th. good cardio, but not my preferred way of getting it!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Bruce!!!!”
Reviews.Author: queendiva08
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great but Bruce is the best! I won't come back unless he is there. I love this hotel. They really focus on providing quality customer service and thats what I received.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Customer Service is Dead and Common Sense is Lacking”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler325
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a 31 story new tower near the convention center in dead downtown Phoenix. Rooms are newer, nice and clean, but nothing special. For $220/night, more was expected. Service? Spotty at best. Great valet and check in experience by young, energetic, and good looking staff. That was a highlight. And now the troubling part...The first night I was in the hotel, I worked late (12:30am) in my room and realized I did not pack saline solution for my contacts. Totally my oversight. The store, which is in the hotel lobby for the convenience of the guests, had closed for the evening. The staff reportedly looked around their back office to see if they could find some saline while they sent me back to my room to wait. None was found. At around 1am, I requested the manager on duty open the store and charge the saline to my room (I could see it on the shelf through the store window!), but the manager on duty refused to open the store even though he had a key. Apparently the Sheraton does not have the business sense to obtain an access agreement for the space they lease out. The manager told me there was nothing he could do and that I would have to go find an open store to buy some. So...in from out of town, in the middle of dead downtown Phoenix, $220 per night, and 1am in the morning...and "there is nothing more I <the manager> can do."?? I questioned the manger's interest in providing customer service of any level, and then endured a lecture on breaking and entering and how he was not going to break the law to accomodate my request. The moral of the story: Take your time in packing if you are staying here and don't forget anything, and may god help you if need something from the management team at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to host a meeting!”
Reviews.Author: MWIcoordinator
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel & the conference services staff. The rooms are nice however the internet is pricey in both the guest rooms & especially in the conference rooms. The bell and front desk staff were very helpful and courteous, however the concierge was lacking in customer service. I needed a drug store on the 3rd day of our meeting so I went to the concierge desk for the closest choice. When approaching the desk there were 2 girls there having a personal conversation, I had to wait for them to finish before they asked me if they could help. :( When I asked about the drug store they gave me a map with information for a drug store 1/2 mile away. I then found out that there was a Walgreens within walking distance, I learned this from the taxi driver that charged me $20 to drive to the drug store that the concierge suggested

Reviews.Title: “Huge and new hotel, nice pool, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: Xman_7
Reviews.Content: A gigantic and very new high-rise hotel, reportedly 7 months old at time of stay. Nice lobby and friendly staff. I found the tour by the bell boy a little intrusive. The rooms are clean, new, and quiet. The room decor is tasteful and muted almost to the point of blandness. The food was decent. The pool is long and narrow -- much better for swimming laps than most hotel pools. They want $13 per day for internet service, which seems excessive in $200/night hotel. I had only one minor problem: being briefly woken up by a short burst of sound from a loud walkie-talkie in the hallway in the middle of the night. I had no other problems, but wasn't bowled over either. Free internet would improve the guest experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room and amenities”
Reviews.Author: MarissaNH
Reviews.Content: My favorite parts of this hotel were the location and the fitness center was wonderful, in fact the nicest I have seen in a hotel. The room was nice and spacious and the front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The free internet cafe in the lobby was nice too. The coffee in the room was actually the best coffee In room that I have ever made, which was great. The location is also perfect for the convention center. Unfortunately, the pool was closed for repairs, so we couldn't sit out near it. There were two other outdoor areas but one was in the shade all the time and had no chairs, the other had a wafting odor coming from somewhere, couldn't quite pinpoint that one! Probably just a city smell... I keep expecting a breakfast at these places, and there never is. For some reason I still keep hoping, but there wasn't! oh well....

Reviews.Title: “Too exaltic to be willing to serve”
Reviews.Author: octogonhd
Reviews.Content: The new Sheraton Downtown is newly opened (October 2008) near perfectly styled hotel in the center of Phoenix. Nice rooms, large beds, a lot of helpful staff members at the entrance. Unfortunately, there are some sub-standard ideas : you want some information about the facilities of the hotel (pool, shoeshine, gym, where to go for breakfast ?) and look for the information book - it is not there, also no information in the TV menue. A call to the concierge reveals: we are a green hotel, we try to save paper in the rooms !? there are some fifteen flyers advertising touristic trips... No WLAN in the room, so-called high speed cable costs 16 USD in addition to the already expensive room rates. Problems with lousy internet connection: call the concierge (because you don't know whom to call), concierge connects you to someone who is not attending th phone - you wait while it is ringing. Another try at the concierge, you are relocated to someone telling you the he will connect you to the concierge..... No mini bar, only room service available, restaurant only from 5-9 pm, but at the bar they urge you to drink rapidly and let your glass refill.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: miasusieq
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown Hotel for a convention and we were both extremely dissapointed. The hotel had a TINY little pool and there were only a very few chairs/loungers for such a huge hotel. We had to pay to access internet in the rooms ($13/day!), which really burns when you already have paid so much for the room. The rooms are absolutely nothing special - I might have been staying in a Holiday Inn for all the character the room had. Overall, I was really disappointed in the hotel. I do recommend the Copper Square Adventures for a personal, guided hike in the mountains, though! If I were to ever come back to Phoenix, I would definitely NOT stay here and would book a room at The Phoenician.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: vikingteacher
Reviews.Content: Wow! I don't even know where to begin. I stayed here for 4 nights and checked out yesterday. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are beautiful and it is all very clean. The problem is the staff. I had a problem with the room deposit upon checkout and the employee that I dealt with was VERY rude. The next morning the problem still wasn't cleared up so I spoke with a manager. While he was very nice, he flat out lied to my face by saying that he had contacted my bank and taken care of everything. I immediately called my bank and they had not been contacted. Now, the day AFTER checking out, I still have a charge on my cc that I do not owe. The other employees that I encountered in the hotel were equally as unhelpful. When I went to ask when the office center opened, I was told, "As soon as the guy gets here to open it." The level of customer service in this hotel is horrible. The employees are either very poorly trained or just don't care. There is a Wyndham and a Hyatt within walking distance of this hotel. The next time that I am in Phoenix I will definitely choose one of those.

Reviews.Title: “If they could get their act together”
Reviews.Author: Esther32
Reviews.Content: If they could get their act together this could be a good choice. It was very clean. It was decorated nicely. The location was very close to the convention center. The service (when you could get it) was friendly. You could park your car yourself (16.00 per day) and not be forced to use valet. Now for the not-so-good. Having arrived late we wanted to order room service. No room service menu in the room. It was on the TV menu. However, no prices were listed. Therefore, 2 small tuna sandwiches, two glasses of milk, one dish of ice cream was $55. Secondly, every time we needed to contact the front desk or housekeeping or whoever, no matter what button we pressed on the phone we got a recording and a wait time. Never once did a person answer the phone directly. On the morning of check out, the bellman told us they expected 400 rooms to check out. Yet, only three people were working the desk. The line was unreal. However the weirdest thing and most unexplainable thing was the bedding. At first we thought the sheets were made of thick paper, then we thought maybe they were bamboo. It wasn't that they were uncomfortable, it was just that they were loud. Yes, LOUD!!! Each time one of us moved in bed, a loud crackling noise woke the other one up. Very very strange. We called housekeeping after the first night and reported this and they were not surprised and promised to change us to "soft" sheets. Those were their words. Also, our rate included breakfast for two each day and at check out we were charged for each breakfast and in order to get those charges removed it took three huddled employees conferencing despite my printed confirmation. So, when they get their act together this place has the potential to be a good choice for a downtown stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: HaveCameraWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Great location. Just two short blocks from the "Light Rail" stop of "Central & Van Buren". Maybe a block & 1/2 to the Convention Center....and close to shopping & eateries. The facility is new. Everything is crisp and clean. (The sheets were even starched, or something - which made them a tad to stiff for my tastes. Nice heath club & pool. The staff couldn't have been friendlier, or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lush, elegant, brand new”
Reviews.Author: APezz
Reviews.Content: After staying two nights at the Sheraton Four Points in Tempe we decided to move closer to downtown and the convention center as we were attending Imaging USA. My husband moved us into the hotel while I was at the convention; he found the staff very helpful. Our room was a double (all queens were booked) on the Starwood Preferred level, 26th floor. After staying in the Tempe location (which was more like a motel), the new lobby of the downtown location took my breath away. Our room had a gorgeous view of Phoenix and the mountains to the north! We left our curtains open all night to peek at the sparkling lights below. The beds were sumptuous; piled high with four pillows and a fluffy duvet. Like sleeping in a cloud! There's a terrace, hot tub, and lap pool outside on the 4th floor, but I didn't have time to use them. I did hit the large exercise room once, but the elliptical trainers were up against the mirror, so I could either stare at myself or look down at the TV/display. Looking down made me motion sick, and I don't get motion sickness! Pros: views, comfy beds, beautiful bathroom, large desk Cons: weird vibrating sound in the bathroom which may have been from the elevators, no robes so I was a bit chilly

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaScottsdale
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is THE place to stay in downtown Phoenix. The hotel is brand new and a wonderful addition to the downtown Phx. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to accomodate you. The pool and workout facility were very nice and comfortable. My kids enjoyed the table games you could rent for the room and the internet computers in the main lobby are a great touch. The restaurant was good, we had breakfast and dinner. The breakfast was terrific, but the dinner was average. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Went for a conference”
Reviews.Author: scooper99
Reviews.Content: I booked rooms for myself and several others. Check-in was not smooth and the CSR was spastic and needed the manager to walk her through step by step. The meeting space (the ballroom) on the second floor was great. The food was amazing! Everything was cooked properly and was seasoned like I would at home. The waitstaff was kind and performed seemlessly. My stay was almost ruined by housekeeping. I wanted ice. Go get the ice bucket right. Can't there are moldy grapes in the bottom. I call for another bucket. I call again. I call again. Finally someone brings me a new bucket, but they leave the old bucket with the moldy grapes and they don't leave any liners for the new bucket. I finally took the bucket with its content downstairs. I was helped by a friendly lady apologized, she later who sent Fiji water to my room. My problem was I could not even relax wondering what else wasn't cleaned... The hotel wasn't even a month old and I understand some kinks need to be worked out but I wish I wasn't involved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice addition to downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: OzExpat
Reviews.Content: The new Sheraton in downtown Phoenix is definitely a nice addition. It is a typical large business oriented hotel, but it has a good location and good amenities. We stayed on the Club floor - although the hotel seemed almost empty the night we were there we were put in a room way at the end of the corridor on the side of the hotel with only one small window. Nicely furnished rooms but small and with just the one small window, not able to fully appreciate the great views from the 28th floor. The Club Lounge was very nice - Stacey who works there was great!! She made our stay. Nice enough pool area on the 4th floor, but it's a little bland. Staff were great everywhere - very friendly and attentive. Cafe in the lobby with free internet (if you're a guest) was nice and the lobby bar is a good place to relax. Didn't try the restaurant, although we came back a week later at 9:45pm on a Friday night and were turned away as they were "no longer serving food" - not even after theater dessert. When will Phoenix start acting like a big city! Overall, decent place to stay as there are not too many options in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: colleen90405
Reviews.Content: Finally, downtown Phoenix has a nice hotel - all these years your only option was dingy old hotels, I would stay on the outskirts at the Ritz. But the new Sheraton - a Starwood hotel - just opened and its lovely, great staff and location. Restaurant had a great menu, too. Staff said the gym was amazing but I did not see it. I got upgraded as a Starwood member to a higher quality room, but to me it didnt look special, looked like a regular room, perhaps b/c there was a view they called it better. Rooms are fine - clean, moder furnishings, bright, internet access - no fridge or food drawer. Downsides are small stuff like the ironing board is miniature, seriously resembles a toy that belonds in a girls' playhouse, hurt to bend over to iron all my suits. And the iron leaks water everywhere.
